headline: AI Operations Strategist | 25+ yrs in Enterprise Systems & Data | Helping Organizations Reduce Costs, Automate Securely & Scale with AI and Managed IT
jobTitle: President & AI Operations / IT Transformation Leader
about:
I am an AI Operations Strategist and IT transformation leader with over 25 years of experience delivering secure, scalable, and resilient technology solutions.

My work focuses on helping organizations responsibly operationalize artificial intelligence through automation, while maintaining strong cybersecurity, governance, and operational controls. I specialize in aligning AI automation initiatives with existing IT infrastructure to reduce operational costs, improve service delivery, and enable sustainable scale.

I work with enterprises, growing businesses, and public sector organizations that want practical AI adoption without compromising security, compliance, or reliability

As President of CMIT Solutions of Sugar Land, part of a national IT services network, I lead the design and delivery of managed IT, cybersecurity, and automation solutions built to meet rigorous operational requirements. My background includes large scale enterprise systems and data platforms at organizations such as Oracle, Hewlett Packard, and complex retail and technology environments, now applied to modern AI and automation initiatives.

Core Areas of Expertise

AI adoption in regulated and mission‑critical environments (finance, healthcare, energy, and public sector)

Governance‑aligned AI and IT modernization for enterprise and government programs
​
Workflow and process automation

Voice AI and conversational systems

Cybersecurity strategy and risk reduction

IT modernization and operational resilience

I work with organizations seeking practical AI adoption without compromising security, reliability, or governance.

If you are leading AI automation or IT modernization in an enterprise, government program, or complex organization and value structured, execution‑focused delivery, I welcome the opportunity to connect.

In addition to leading CMIT Solutions of Sugar Land and myassistant365.ai, I am available for fractional leadership, consulting engagements, and advisory roles with enterprises and public sector organizations focused on AI operations, secure automation, and IT transformation.

experiences.title: President & AI Operations / IT Transformation Leader
experiences.jobDescription:
Lead technology strategy and service delivery for secure IT operations, cybersecurity, and AI driven automation initiatives within a national services organization.

Responsible for designing and operating resilient IT environments that support automation, reliability, and long term scalability. Work includes modernizing infrastructure, implementing governance aligned technology controls, and integrating AI enabled workflows into existing operational systems.

Key responsibilities include:

Oversight of managed IT operations, cybersecurity, and automation delivery

Design of secure, scalable infrastructure supporting AI and automation initiatives

Integration of AI driven workflows into core business and service operations

Risk reduction, system reliability, and operational resilience

Technology strategy, vendor evaluation, and implementation oversight

updates.postText:
Last month, I led a training session for a local organization on using generative AI in everyday business workflows. The discussions and questions that followed revealed a clear pattern, many professionals want to use GenAI, but struggle with how to apply it practically and responsibly in real work scenarios.
That experience became the catalyst for this book.
This book distills hands-on training insights into a clear, actionable guide for professionals and business leaders who want to move beyond experimentation and use generative AI with confidence, structure, and measurable business impact.
If you are looking to turn GenAI from a curiosity into a practical work tool, this book was written for you.
🔗 https://amzn.to/3YbPqtu

Most business owners think AI adoption is about tools.
 It’s not.
It’s about expectations.
Between 2025 and 2026, something critical changed — quietly.
AI moved from:
 • “Nice-to-have” → assumed productivity layer
 • Experimentation → daily operations
 • Asking questions → assigning responsibilities
In 2026:
 👉 Knowing how to use AI will be assumed
 👉 Manual execution questioned
 👉 Speed and systems will become the real differentiator
This carousel breaks down:
 • The silent AI shift of 2025 most teams missed
 • Why business owners must move from executor to operator
 • What AI Operations actually means (beyond prompts)
 • How small businesses can create leverage without adding headcount
 • Real, practical systems already working today
This isn’t about replacing people.
 It’s about designing systems that multiply output.
By 2026, high performers won’t manage tasks.
 They’ll manage systems.
If you’re a founder, CEO, or small business owner, this shift directly affects how competitive you’ll be next year.
Swipe through.
 Then ask yourself one question:
Are you operating the system — or still doing the work inside it?
—
 Rashmi Sheel
 AI Operations Strategist
#AIOperations #AIForBusiness #FounderMindset #FutureOfWork #SmallBusinessGrowth #AILeadership

If your AI strategy lives in slides, you're already behind.
Too many businesses are trapped in pilot purgatory:
 🚫 Endless demos
 🚫 Tool trials
 🚫 No deployment
According to the 2025 Enterprise AI Trends Report:
 🔹 50% of companies never move past pilots
 🔹 46% struggle with system integration
 🔹 Financial & healthcare sectors are scaling fast
 🔹 Winners focus on cost, speed & security — not hype
 Here's the difference between talkers and doers:
 ✅ Action > Analysis
 ✅ Execution > Experimentation
 ✅ Real ROI > Buzzwords
AI leaders aren’t waiting.
They're already:
  🔹Cutting costs
  🔹Speeding service
  🔹Outpacing the competition
Every day you plan, they profit.
 🚫Stop treating AI like a science project.
 ✅ Start treating it like a business accelerator.

What's one AI initiative your team actually scaled?
👇 Share your execution story in the comments.
 📊 Link to the full 2025 AI Trends Report below.

I had the opportunity to speak at an event hosted by Indo American Chamber of Commerce of Greater Houston as part of the IACCGH Small Business Series on Cybercrime in Texas, How Small Businesses Can Protect Themselves and Benefit from the New Cyber Law, and I am grateful for the chance to engage with so many committed leaders and professionals. The conversations were insightful, the questions were thoughtful, and the energy in the room reflected a shared commitment to strengthening cybersecurity across our business community.
Thank you to the IACCGH team for the invitation and for organizing a valuable program. I also appreciate everyone who participated and contributed to a productive dialogue. It was a privilege to share ideas, connect with new colleagues, and discuss practical steps that can help small businesses navigate emerging risks.
A special acknowledgment to our event sponsors, Wallice Bank and Center Point Energy, whose support made the program possible. Photo credit to Bijay Dixit.
I look forward to continuing the conversation and supporting efforts that help Texas businesses stay resilient and informed.
Jagdip Ahluwalia, Wallis Bank, CenterPoint Energy, CMIT Solutions of Sugar Land, CMIT Solutions, Bijay Dixit, Indo-American Chamber of Commerce, India, Indo-American Chamber of Commerce of Greater Houston

headline: Personal CFO (Chief Financial Officer) for you & your family / business. I help you build and manage your "Wealth Team" so you can spend your time doing what matters most.
about:
I'm Ian, I help discerning investors, families and business owners take back as much of their time as possible, while making sure they don't miss out of investment opportunities, and tax strategies to keep more of their wealth and pay as little as possible to Uncle Sam.


The way we'll work together is a bit different than what most people are used to, or expect from a financial advisor. Here's how we create a team that works for YOU:

We act as a Personal CFO (Chief Financial Officer) for you or your family / business. We help you build and manage your "Wealth Team" - the group of specialists that guides through every financial area: Tax preparation, Investments, Real Estate, Banking, Estate Planning, Corporate Law, Insurance, etc.

Most people we talk to have accumulated various professionals in these disciplines over time, and each one exists in their own "silo", and rarely do they communicate, let alone work together to make sure you're not missing out on any strategies or opportunities.

We come and help you make sure:
1. Those specialists are all "A" players - they are experts in their field, and they're proactive.
2. They work together and communicate.

We take over as the main point of contact for your "Wealth Team" so that you don't have to waste time having the same conversation with each one of them to try to get anything done.

We're simply adding a buffer for you - so that you can spend your time on what you enjoy most. When you get a "Pitch" of some product, investment strategy or idea, you simply toss it to us, we'll evaluate it with your team, and then present it to you if we think it makes sense. If it doesn't - you don't have to worry about it again.

Time is your most precious resource, we help you keep it, and spend it well.

Send DM to request a Strategy Session

updates.postText:
The worst conversations I have start the same way:

"Ian, I wish we'd met sooner!"

Most people call me after the big moment happens. After the baby. After the job change. After they start thinking about retirement.

And I get it. Life is chaos. You're just trying to survive.

But when you wait, you're now making six-figure decisions while you're emotionally fried, overwhelmed, and out of time.

That's when mistakes happen. Expensive ones.

That's why I'm obsessed with working with people before the transition hits.

Before the baby comes and you're too tired to think straight.

Before the job change when you still have options.

Especially a few years before retirement when there's still time to optimize everything.

Because when you plan ahead, you're calm. You're thoughtful. You make better decisions.

So if there's a little voice in your head right now saying, "Hmm, should I be working with someone?"

Listen to it.

That voice is right. And it's probably about six months late already. 

Don't let it be a year.

DM me. Let's have the conversation now, not after you wish we had.

I used to work three jobs just to keep the lights on.

👉  A bank
👉 Banana Republic
👉 Sunglass Hut

My wife and I got married at 21 and we had no money. Like, none.

At Banana Republic, I had to dress a certain way for the job, but I couldn't afford to buy the clothes there. 

So I learned how to make it work, buying from thrift stores and teaching myself about style in the process.

Fast forward to now, and I help families manage generational wealth.

Wild, right?

Those years taught me that most people wait too long to ask for help.

They wait until after the business sells. 
After the kid is born. 
After retirement starts. 

And by then, they've already missed half the opportunities that mattered.

As a Personal CFO, I work with people before the big transition happens. Ideally 12-18 months out.

Why? 

Because if we're going to work together through something major, we need time. 

Time for me to learn how you think. Time for you to decide if my approach makes sense for your family.

So when the moment comes 👉 the sale, the retirement, the next chapter, we're already moving. Not catching up.

I spent years scrambling. 

I don't want that for the people I work with.

If you've got something big on the horizon and you want to make sure you don't miss anything, start the conversation now. 

Seriously. Sooner than you think.

I got married at 22, worked three jobs, and had all three kids before I turned 28.

Now I'm running a financial planning practice and building a wine distribution company on the side.

I can't help myself. 

I'm an entrepreneur at heart, and it's just how my brain works.

That's why I love working with entrepreneurial people. 

I get what it takes to do the work you're doing. I know what you're going through and what you've gone through.

But I also recognize that money isn't the end goal. 

It's a tool that can help you accomplish those goals.

For me, it's enjoying and sharing art with the people I love, which often means wine. 

I love art in different forms, and wine is one of them. 

So we're building a distribution company to share that with people we enjoy.

That's really what financial planning is about to me.

Empowering your goals and funding the things you actually want to do in your life.

Whether that's building multiple businesses, passing wealth through generations, or just having the freedom to pursue what matters to you, that's what gets me excited about this work as a financial planner and entrepreneur.

If you're a business owner or someone thinking about your financial strategy but unsure where to start, let's talk.

Drop a comment or shoot me a DM and we’ll set up a quick call so I can learn more about your situation and answer any of your questions.

You didn't build a business to spend your nights stressed about cash flow, tax strategies, or estate planning.

I help families delegate all the financial stuff they don't want to deal with...

- Cash flow
- Debt
- Investments
- Risk
- Estate planning
- Tax optimization

so they can get back to what actually matters.

I make it simple, build you the right team, and act as your personal CFO.

And if you want to talk Burgundy while we're at it? Even better. 🍷

If your financial situation feels too complex to manage alone, let's talk.

I'm looking for 3 more families to partner with before the end of the year who value clarity over complexity.

DM me and we’ll set up a quick call so I can learn more about your situation and answer any of your questions.

volunteerAndAwards.description: I mentor youth in the foster care system by establishing a strong fundamental relationship with the teen to be able to provide everything from having fun to being a reliable confidant, role model, ally, advocate and helping navigate life.

I provide emotional and physical support for deployed soldiers and Special Ops teams through letter-writing and care packages – My goal is to let them know that they are appreciated and hopefully give them a little something to smile about, a brief respite from their daily stresses, a taste of home, their favorite comfort food or just knowing that someone out there is thinking of them.

recommendations.name: Nalasa Cutler
recommendations.subtitle: Founder of Ascension Aesthetics | Environmental Soul Design™ | Reimagining Space as a Living, Breathing Force
recommendations.description:
I recently had the pleasure of experiencing a Home+Soul Re'Fresh session with Nalasa, and I cannot recommend it enough! From start to finish, the session was both calming and invigorating, leaving me feeling renewed and refreshed in both my personal mindset as well as the plan for the interior of my new home. 

Nalasa's attention to detail is unparalleled, and I was amazed at how she immediately tuned into our unique circumstances as it relates to the land and property of our building site. She provided several recommendations right away as to how we can align and be congruent moving forward. 

I have never really designed a home with my personal aesthetic because we knew we weren’t staying put, so I have always focused on what would resell.  But instead of enjoying the process of FINALLY getting to do whatever I want, it was overshadowed by the stress of making a zillion decisions and making sure everything is right!  We are putting a lot of money into this home, so I want to make sure it has the feel and design that is scattered into a bunch of different pieces in my brain! 

Throughout the session, Nalasa's energy was positive and infectious, making the process both enjoyable and transformative. She calmed me down 😊 and gave me some great next steps to chunk things up and prioritize, which will help me during the design (and budgeting!) process so that I don’t feel so out of control.

She was able to pull a “vision” out of me, which I hadn’t really been able to describe. Nalasa asked me questions that helped me identify what it is that I love – and more accurately, the emotions that they make me feel, such that I can bring that into the interior design of my home.  She gave me clarity, structure, and confidence in the decisions I make to turn my vision into reality. 

Thank you so much, Nalasa – I have a renewed, expansive perspective… and I now have a structure to bring my vision and how I want my environment to feel into my home so that I can live my dream every day!
I highly recommend working with Nalasa. Her work is truly transformative, and I cannot wait to see the final result. Thank you, Nalasa, for helping me create a space that truly nourishes my soul!

Cami Low
CEO Results By Cami

headline: AI Driven Venture Builder | Advisor | Investor | Innovator | Strategist | Founder @ WeBet Social | Disinformation Authority | Helping Founders Build & Execute A World Class Metrics Driven Growth Plan For Their Business
about:
Seasoned startup founder and business advisor with over 20 years of entrepreneurial experience as a 5x founder and advisor to 40+ startups. I help founders turn ideas into scalable, investor-ready businesses through systematic product growth, revenue acceleration, and fundraising strategies that deliver real traction. My purpose-driven growth frameworks are designed to help companies:

Achieve product–market fit faster
Scale rapidly with repeatable systems
Build a category-leading brand that dominates its niche

I’m passionate about partnering with mission-aligned founders, investors, and operators to create ventures that make an impact and grow with purpose.

If growth is among the top three most important things for your business right now and you would like to strategize together, visit the Calendly link below to schedule a call and let's connect:

https://calendly.com/benklein/wcg_30

✉ ben@worldclassgrowth.com
☎ 917-855-0103
🌎 http://worldclassgrowth.com

➡ ABOUT WORLD CLASS GROWTH ⬅

World Class Growth helps empower entrepreneurs to grow their business through various digital growth strategies. We help you identify your target audience online and advise on how best to reach that audience with the correct messaging at the correct time on the correct channel.

Companies We’ve Helped Grow Include: 10x Management, Reefill, Tipalti, Dash Robotics, Open Studio Network, and the many companies through the Berkeley Skydeck startup accelerator program.

➡ GET HELP GROWING YOUR BUSINESS ⬅

You have some early customers and have begun generating some revenue. Now the question becomes, how do you find and gain A LOT more of both? Going from zero to a sustainable lead generation machine is not a simple task. So many businesses get stuck at this stage. Lacking a repeatable way to acquire customers. WCG’s client growth process details actionable strategies you can begin executing immediately. This quick start guide is broken down into three phases; preparation, testing, and scaling/automation, and can be applied to any business’s marketing plan for determining your position in the digital marketplace while properly monitoring and efficiently maximizing your ROI.

➡  LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR GROWTH PROCESS ⬅

Take a look at my latest Growth Workshop from my most recent talk for the Berkeley Skydeck program by clicking below:

➡ ABOUT ME ⬅

My career began in the real estate industry in 2004 selling new homes in Charlotte, NC where I learned the importance of a sales process and the psychology of selling which I later transferred to the digital landscape as the founder of Next Level Digital Marketing. 

Through this company, I’ve built several profitable businesses ranging from e-commerce information products including affiliate and email marketing to mobile apps and games.

He will one day succeed Joe, and carry on the family legacy as a Homebuilder of Integrity.

Eastwood Homes currently operates in 6 divisions in North Carolina, South Carolina, and Virginia.

headline: #1 Best-selling author helps you scale your business to 7 figures without burning out.  DM me “SCALE 7” and I’ll give you a free playbook that shows you how ↓
jobTitle: The Impossible Success Coach™ and #1 Bestselling Author
jobLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
If you're an entrepreneur who wants to scale your business to 7 figures without burning out, this is for you↓

Most of us have been taught to set incremental goals to achieve incremental progress. That works, but it sells us short. For all the media frenzy about artificial intelligence, the most powerful computer on the planet is still the one between your ears. If you program it with the right set of instructions, it will give you the results you seek.

I can show you how to do the right programming to scale your business to 7 figures without burning out. Think of it as prompt engineering for human intelligence.

There’s nothing complicated about it. There’s no ten-step process to memorize, no checklist to follow, no mantra to chant. It’s not limited by language, gender, culture, race, education, age, or IQ. Anyone on the planet can do this, as long as they’re committed to the outcome.

Think of commitment as the ultimate prompt to your brain. If you’re daydreaming about something, your brain isn’t receiving any instructions to make it happen. But when you commit to it, your brain immediately switches into a different gear and starts doing everything in its power, which is considerable, to give you what you’re committed to.

The problem is, most of us don’t commit to much. I can still remember being told when I was a kid that if I don’t expect too much from life I won’t be disappointed. That was true as far as it went, but it didn’t go very far, and it didn’t take me very far. I had to learn the hard way that the world will pay whatever price you ask from it. If you ask little, you’ll receive little. If you ask a great deal, then you’ll receive a great deal.

Here’s the bottom line: If you’re willing to commit to scaling your business to 7 figures without burning out (even if you think that's impossible!) then I can help you achieve it. 

Full Stop.

But I can’t help you commit to it. I can’t give you a compelling reason to want something enough to be willing to commit to it. That has to come from you.

But when you're ready, when you're committed, I can help you make it happen.

In fact, I’ve boiled it down to a playbook that lays it all out for you, and for a limited time I can send you a copy for free.

Here's the link:

https://www.keithellis.com/about-keith-ellis-2

experiences.title: Author: SCALE TO SEVEN FIGURES WITHOUT BURNING OUT
experiences.jobDescription:
Do you ever feel trapped by your success?

You've created a thriving business, and that feels great, but the more successful you become, the more your business takes over your life. That's not so great. 

I bet you created your business to give yourself and your family a greater sense of financial freedom, and beyond that, to have the time and resources to enjoy all that life offers. And yet, the harder you work, the more trapped you feel.

So you hire business coaches and consultants, and they help you grow your business, at least incrementally, but they can't seem to help you scale it to the level you’ve always dreamed about because you just don't have any more time or energy to give.

Even worse, the more you do grow your business, the more it sucks the life out of you.
 
You’ve reached the point where you can’t tell whether you own your business or your business owns you. I call this “success prison". 

Well, I've been there and done that, and I've escaped from success prison, so I can finally enjoy both my success and my life. And I can help you do the same.
 
I know, it sounds impossible to scale your business to 7 figures by reducing the demands your business makes on you. But that's what makes it work.

The secret is to commit to an Impossible Goal™. This turns conventional wisdom on its head by liberating you from the trap of incremental progress, so you're finally unleashed to pursue your dreams, start living again, and enjoy the time, energy, and resources to do it all.

But there is a trick to it, and it’s something they don’t teach in business school: 

It’s actually easier to achieve Impossible Goals™ than it is to be "realistic".

At this point, you probably find that hard to believe, but by the time you finish reading my new book, I guarantee you’ll understand.

And for a limited time, I will give you a free copy. 

DM me "Scale to 7" and I'll send you the link.

publications.title: HOW TO MAKE THE IMPOSSIBLE EASY: The 12 Secrets of Exponential Growth
publications.summary:
Most of us have spent our lives following the conventional wisdom that incremental progress will eventually yield success. There's truth in that, but there's also something very important that's missing. When you focus on incremental goals and incremental progress, you end up burying yourself under details that leave you exhausted, overwhelmed, and wondering how you got into this predicament in the first place. 

To put it another way, do you ever feel trapped by your success?

You've created a thriving business, and that feels great, but the more successful you become, the more your business takes over your life. That's not so great. 

I bet you created your business to give yourself and your family a greater sense of financial freedom, and beyond that, to have the time and resources to enjoy all that life offers. And yet, the harder you work, the more trapped you feel. I call this “success prison". 

I know it sounds like a cliche to say that I've been there and done that, but I really have been there, and I really have done that. More importantly, I've escaped from success prison, so I can finally enjoy both my success and my life. And I can show you how to do the same. 

I know, it sounds impossible to be able to scale your business exponentially while actually scaling back the demands your business makes on you. And that’s why I call it "Impossible Success".
 
The secret is to turn conventional wisdom on its head by liberating yourself from the trap of ‘realistic’ goals, so you're finally free to pursue your dreams, and start living again, and you finally have the time, energy, and resources to do it all.

But there is a trick to it, and it’s something they don’t teach in business school:

It’s actually easier to achieve “impossible success” than it is to be realistic.

At this point, you probably find that hard to believe, but by the time you finish reading this book, I guarantee you’ll understand.

publications.title: MAGIC QUESTIONS 2.0: How to Transform Your Life at the Speed of Thought
publications.summary:
MAGIC QUESTIONS 2.0 is about an astonishing secret that can transform your work, your wealth, your health, your relationships, and your entire life.

If you’re skeptical about a claim like this I don't blame you. I know I would be if it hadn't actually happened to me.

But it did, and I accidentally discovered a mind-blowing secret that allows me to live the life I've always dreamed about.

And now this secret can do the same for you.

It all began when I joined a tiny Internet startup named webMethods. I was only their sixth employee.
As the newly-minted VP of Sales my job was to sell a product that wasn’t finished, from a company no one had ever heard of, to a market that didn’t exist.

I struggled.

When we were running out of money, I was still struggling, and we were running out of time.

And then somehow, miraculously, I stumbled upon an astonishing secret that changed everything.

The rest is history. Three years later webMethods went public in one of the largest software IPOs ever.

And now I want to share this secret with you.

Believe it or not, most of us spend our lives trapped by the conventional wisdom about success. If you’ve ever read any books about success or attended any seminars or mastermind groups, and yet your life still isn’t turning out the way you thought it would, then maybe you understand what I mean. Even if you’ve never put it in so many words.

You see, the mind-blowing secret that I want to share with you isn't about conventional wisdom. It's about what’s missing from conventional wisdom. It’s about what’s missing from all the books, seminars, and advice you’ve ever heard about success.

If you're dying to break free of the conventional results you've been getting from conventional wisdom, then you're in the right place at the right time.

Because I want to reveal this secret to you in my blockbuster new book: MAGIC QUESTIONS 2.0.

To learn more visit: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0D8KP4M5D

publications.title: NO SECRETS: A Bestselling Thriller
publications.summary:
Welcome to version 4.0 of this story, newly revised for 2021.

The first incarnation was entitled QUANTUM ETHICS. It quickly became the #1 bestselling techno-thriller on the Amazon Kindle and remained on the Top Ten List list for six months.

I enjoyed writing it so much that I couldn't stop tinkering with it, so I revised it twice, and returned to the original working title—NO SECRETS.

Version 4.0 updates the story one last time. Please understand this is not a sequel, nor is it a fourth volume in a series. NO SECRETS (4.0) is a revision of previous versions, much as software gets revised or the “Director’s Cut” of a movie creates a more finished product.

Here you’ll find some revised scenes, a new ending, name changes for a couple of characters, a thousand tiny tweaks, and several bug fixes, all intended to provide a better read.

Despite all these changes, if you've read any (or all) of the previous titles one can hardly expect you to read this version. Unless, like I do, you believe that some stories are worth reading again and again. 

Here's the story in a nutshell:

The NSA is moving mountains to build the world’s first quantum computer, a device so powerful it will give them the means to break into every computer on the planet, and to own every secret. 

But what if a brilliant young scientist beats them to it?

What if the NSA tries to steal her device?

What if the terrorists get there first?

If you like action, adventure, compelling characters, and a climax guaranteed to take your breath away—over and over again—then you know why this story became the #1 best-selling technothriller on the Kindle and spent six months on the bestseller list.

headline: Founder | Author | Financial Guru
about:
Jennifer Brazer #QueenofCAS launched one of the first virtual CAS (client accounting services) departments in 2007 with one central theme: efficient business practices. Simple is better. Ideas that are simple for the customer to understand, the staff to execute, and the shareholders to embrace will ultimately result in success.

When it comes to accounting, we really need to look to the future. It is no longer necessary to be beholden to the traditional methods. GAAP can be met using paperless record keeping, cloud technology, and web conferencing more efficiently and less expensively than in paper-stuffed cubicles staffed with bored commuters. By removing that layer of unnecessary overhead, we can make financial literacy available and affordable to small businesses and households nationwide.

With the ability to be completely cloud-based, leverage AI for the grunt work, and fully integrate back office technologies Complete Controller can deliver a personalized, accurate and timely product at an affordable price. Using Jennifer's methods, Complete Controller fulfills direct-to-client services and provides a reliable outsourced turnkey CAS department solution to accounting professionals and firms, allowing them to gain the independence they need and focus on higher revenue services and maintain their independence.

For those that want to build their own cloud-based professional service business, Jennifer gives away all of her secrets, strategies, bumps, and bruises in her book, From Cubicle to Cloud {pub date January 2021}. For a deep dive into cloud structures, business models, and profit builders. Go to jenniferbrazer.com to learn more.

We will continue to see great things in this dynamic area of expertise.

Specialties: Virtualization, Green Companies, Paperless Strategies, Remote Bookkeeping, Integrated Technology Stack, Efficient Practices, QuickBooks, Analysis Reporting

Futuristic: Predictive Reporting, Blockchain, AI Optimization

experiences.title: Thought Leader | Author
experiences.jobDescription:
Jennifer's new book, From Cubicle to Cloud, is available for pre-order on Amazon with a publish date of January 2021.

This essential guide for anyone who wants to create a cloud-based professional service business is centered on Jennifer Brazer’s deep, personal experiences while building her company, Complete Controller. Her groundbreaking business, which disrupted and reinvented client accounting services (CAS), is one of the first completely cloud-based accounting services in the country.

Brazer documents how she listened to and learned to rely on her inner voice to guide her through the creation of an entirely new business model and to power through the ups and downs of its evolution. Whether your specialty is accounting, therapy, tailoring, design, law, or any other field, you will 

•	learn practical strategies for breaking free of the hours-for-dollars box,
•	develop a business model based on value and work product,
•	create processes and protocols that allow other people to fulfill the scopes of work,
•	foster culture that attracts talent and discourages inefficiency,
•	realize greater profits by adding complimentary services and products.   

This book is for entrepreneurs at any point in their journey to the cloud, providing indispensable tools that will set up a cloud-based professional service for maximum success. Learn more at jenniferbrazer.com.

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.jobDescription: What is Complete Controller? The turnkey CAS department for hundreds of CPA firms, fractional CFOs, family trust attorneys, and business coaches across the nation. But we didn't start there, we started by going direct to small business owners, family trusts, and households with our bookkeeping service and records storage solution. Hosted within our private cloud environment, the Complete Controller platform contains everything found in a traditional accounting department: bookkeepers, controllers, tech stack, document management, peer review, and financial performance reporting. We transcend in-house solutions by offering 24X7 secure access and eliminating the expense of overhead and management. CPAs who love our work have adopted us as their singular bookkeeping solution 'powered by Complete Controller' to gain the advantage of on demand access to all of their customers data and an expert team providing expert bookkeeping along with all of the tools they need to run their back office in one integrated portal. Our reliable delivery of client satisfaction and accurate books helps all members of the financial team to be more effective and profitable. It's a win all the way around.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
My outsourced accounting solution provides a Controller level of expertise to small businesses and households nationally which, under traditional models, was cost prohibitive. Furthermore, our hosted accounting desktop provides the transparency customers need to stay connected while we do the work via the cloud. Please visit www.completecontroller.com to view our comprehensive menu of services.

As Founder of Complete Controller, my vision was to created a remote access accounting desktop where clients, partners, CPA's and other team members would securely view their accounting data as it was efficiently processed by my staff from source document to finished reports. I hired and trained experienced bookkeepers to service clients and developed a performance model to encourage efficiency and allow us to provide full-service accounting at a fraction of usual cost.
experiences.jobLocation: Costa Mesa - Austin - Seattle - Denver - Atlanta

experiences.title: Administrative Director / Controller
experiences.jobDescription: Developed administrative systems for complete financial management, loss prevention, insurance administration and human resource management for 7MM sales residential remodel & custom home builder. Hired and trained administrative staff, developed and implemented performance incentive plans, managed all complex and lender financed projects, performed contract enforcement, collections and audit liaison services.

experiences.title: Financial Administrator / Outside Controller
experiences.jobDescription: Worked independently with twenty-two companies performing all functions of financial control and reporting. Analyzed existing administrative functions and financial controls, developed plans for improvement, and implemented those plans. Primary tasks include clean-up of existing records and systems, organization of duties to create maximum efficiency, and staff and client training. It is during this period that the Complete Controller solution was born. I remained Financial Director/Outside Controller to many of these companies during the development of Complete Controller and eventually converted some to the virtual accounting solution.

experiences.title: Controller
experiences.jobDescription:
I have had the pleasure of working with many wonderful companies over the years including professional firms and consultancies, manufacturing and construction companies and retail businesses. Each has its unique set of financial management challenges. In all instances they have benefited from honing their financial processes to increase efficiency and organization – this is what I enjoy. The result is a stable and accurate financial system that provides invaluable knowledge about a company's current and future position; the power to achieve their goals. My goal is to bring that power to small businesses across the nation.

- Jennifer Brazer

Designed and administered financial controls for internal auditing, trust account management, billing and aggressive collections. Marc Levine, Esq. is presently a Complete Controller client.

experiences.title: Business Partner / Business Plan Writer

Our company prepared full scope business plans for our clients' use in presenting their businesses to investors and lending institutions. My responsibilities included producing complete financial prospectus including pro forma balance sheet, profit & loss, cash flow, start-up cost analysis, return on investment analysis. This business failed when the venture capital investment frenzy crashed.

headline: Founder & Managing Partner, Swift Insights Inc. | Organizational Psychologist & Executive Coach | Transforming Tech & Biotech Leadership | Org Design, Culture & Conflict Resolution Expert |  Former Global CPO
addressWithCountry: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
about:
I’ve spent over 20 years leading in tech and biotech organizations through scale and restructuring, including serving as a Global Chief People Officer. I’ve worked inside companies growing from $30M to $5.5B, building leadership teams and operating models under real execution pressure.

I’ve sat in hundreds of leadership meetings where the strategy was sound and the talent was strong, yet progress slowed. What I see repeatedly is leadership systems lagging behind complexity. Directors and VPs absorb friction, decisions resurface, and senior leaders become the point of integration to keep work moving.

This shows up operationally:
• Leaders spending more time coordinating than executing
• Decisions revisited across meetings and weeks
• Escalations becoming the default path forward

The cost is slower execution and growing dependence on a small number of senior leaders.

I work with executives to redesign how leadership operates so strategy shows up in decisions, meetings, and follow-through. The work is hands-on and practical. We clarify decision rights, tighten escalation paths, redesign meeting cadence, and reset leadership habits so accountability moves without constant intervention.

Clients often turn to me when the pressure is high, the system feels stretched, and the path forward demands both courage and clarity. The goal is not more process, but a leadership system that can carry scale without relying on heroics.
Beyond my consulting and coaching practice, I serve as a trusted advisor to leaders and teams seeking to reimagine how they work and grow together. 

I am an ICF-certified coach and I hold a Ph.D. in Organizational Psychology, an M.A. in Industrial and Social Psychology, and a B.A. in Psychology

Contact Shirley at Shirley@Swift-Insights.com

📩 Shirley@Swift-Insights.com

educations.title: Alliant International University
educations.subtitle: Ph.D Organizational Psychology
educations.description:
Research: SET (Science, Engineering, and Technology) managers’ intentions in hiring, developing, and retaining SET professional women.

Professional SET women remain underrepresented in SET organizations. Companies have undertaken a multitude of initiatives to remedy the problem. The outcomes of these efforts have been mixed, and the under-representation of professional SET women continues to grow. In this research study, I set forth a mixed-method research design to examine the correlates of SET organization managers’ intentions related to hiring, developing, and retaining SET women. The theory of planned behavior (TPB) (Ajzen, 1991) was used to assess and predict SET managers’ intentions to engage in Women-Friendly Behaviors (WFB) toward SET women.

publications.title: ATTITUDES AND COMPANY PRACTICES AS PREDICTORS OF MANAGERS’ INTENTIONS TO HIRE, DEVELOP, AND PROMOTE WOMEN IN SCIENCE, ENGINEERING, AND TECHNOLOGY PROFESSIONS
publications.source: Consulting Psychology Journal: Practice and Research © 2014
publications.summary:
This article won the Elliott Jacques Memorial Award for Best Journal Article in 2014 from The Society of Consulting Psychology/ APA.

Some industries struggle more than others to hire, develop, promote and retain women. In this research study we studied the factors that influence SET managers' decision making when they are working on this problem. Insights from the study have informed our approach to helping companies gain a competitive advantage through talent strategies.

recommendationsReceived.description:
I was fortunate enough to be hired by Shirley to work for her at Zadara. Shirley is an incredibly strong, passionate and driven leader who brings a wealth of HR experience and knowledge. While we were at Zadara, she was responsible for developing a world class organization. She was focused on providing talent management,  organizational development, HR Operations & On Boarding, Recruitment, Compensation, HR Business Partnership, Training, Learning & Development, and building a positive employee experience to form a strong culture across the globe.  

While working together at Zadara, we had to scale and grow very quickly in a short period of time. In addition, she had to lead our team through change management; development of new processes, build system enhancements & integrations to name a few. As a fearless leader, she lead our team throughout these changes and allowed her direct team to lead and manage their specific functions. She provided autonomy to me while being a constant advocate for me. She encouraged me to think out of the box and to be innovative. In fact, this is one of her many strengths. 

She has this innate ability to think strategically on a global level to truly transform and drive our organization to a higher level of performance.  While she is very strategic, she was also very hands on and is not afraid to jump in and solve an issue. She knows how to partner with her executives and board members to coach them through challenging situations.  

I thoroughly enjoyed working with Shirley and would love to work with her again! She would be an asset to any organization as she is extremely dedicated, loyal and  will drive any HR team to achieve the highest level of success.

We furnish and install roller shades, blinds, drapery, blackout systems, motorized solutions, and safety-driven window applications — with one clear goal:

Light and privacy control that creates safe, efficient, and comfortable spaces to learn, work, and live.

Who we serve:
	•	Public & private schools, colleges, and universities
	•	City, state, and federal agencies
	•	Facilities teams, procurement officers, architects, and general contractors
	•	Commercial and institutional clients who require compliance, reliability, and accountability

Why clients trust us:
	•	Deep understanding of public procurement & compliance
	•	OSHA-certified, insured installation teams
	•	Experience across NYC DOE, DCAS, DASNY, BOCES, Columbia University, and municipal facilities
	•	A practical, problem-solving approach — not sales talk

I believe window treatments are not decorative add-ons. They are infrastructure — impacting safety, privacy, energy efficiency, focus, and well-being.

If you’re responsible for spaces where people learn, work, or gather — you’re in the right place.

👉 Follow for insights on facilities planning, compliance, procurement, and creating environments that truly work.

headline: Helping Private Equity & Mid-Market Leaders Build High-Performance Teams | Precision Executive Search for CFOs, COOs & Senior Operators | We Solve Business Problems Through People | Book a 1:1 Call via Featured Section
about:
↳ Frustrated by how long it takes to find the right executive leader?
↳ Or tired of recruiters who send résumés instead of real solutions?
↳ Maybe you’ve experienced the cost of a bad hire - time, money, and momentum lost.)

I’m 𝗖𝗵𝗿𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗽𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝗛𝗮𝘆𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗱, Founder of 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗘𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗔𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆 (𝗦𝗘𝗔) - a firm built on one simple truth:

The difference between a good hire and the right hire isn’t the people - it’s the process.

We’re not traditional recruiters. SEA was founded by a UCLA MBA and former Accenture consultant to bring management consulting precision to leadership search. Our model was originally designed to solve complex hiring challenges for Private Equity portfolio CFOs and COOs, where speed, selectivity, and leadership chemistry matter most.

𝗢𝘂𝗿 𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗢𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴: 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵:

We help organizations secure elite CFO, COO, and senior operational leaders - people who elevate performance, not just fill a seat.

Every engagement includes:

• 80–120 prequalified off-market candidates (no job postings).
• A transparent, data-driven process with weekly progress updates.
• Behavioral and business-fit evaluations for true alignment.
• A full 1-year guarantee on every placement.

𝗪𝗵𝗼 𝗪𝗲 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗪𝗶𝘁𝗵:

• CFOs, COOs, CEOs, and Founders of high-growth or PE-backed companies.
• Organizations with 50–2,000 employees and $50M–$2B+ in revenue.
• Industries: Private Equity, Consumer, Industrial, and Professional Services.

Our clients value precision, transparency, and a peer-level partnership that understands their strategic goals.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗦𝗘𝗔:

1- We don’t post jobs - we create talent ecosystems.
2- We know every candidate we submit.
3- We deliver faster, smarter, and more transparently than legacy recruiting firms.
4- We stand behind every engagement with a 1-year guarantee.

𝗟𝗲𝘁’𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁:

If you’re a CFO, COO, or Founder building a leadership team for the next stage of growth - or if you simply value knowing great operators - let’s connect.

Check out my Featured Section below to book an Intro Call and explore how SEA can help you build the team your strategy deserves.

publications.title: Grow fast or die slow: Why unicorns are staying private
publications.summary: Technology companies worth more than $1 billion—and many worth $10 billion—have fewer reasons to go public than they did in the past. Here’s what that means for them and their investors.

publications.title: Grow fast or die slow: The double-edged sword of M&A
publications.summary: Our latest research on growth in software and online-services companies has some surprising findings about the benefits and risks of buying growth.

publications.title: Wanted: More women in technology
publications.summary: The founder of Girls Who Code discusses the need for gender diversity in technical fields and ways companies can begin to achieve it.

publications.title: Reborn in the cloud
publications.summary: Adobe executives discuss the company’s move from selling shrink-wrapped products to offering web-based software and services.

publications.title: Global Information Technology Report 2015: 1.5 - Creating the Next Wave of Economic Growth with Inclusive Internet
Grow fast or die slow: Pivoting beyond the core
publications.summary: Turbocharged initial growth is essential to surviving in the software industry. But what comes next? Here are four lessons so leaders can write their organizations’ second act.

publications.title: Offline and Falling Behind: Barriers to Internet Adoption
publications.summary: More than 60 percent of the world’s population remains offline. Without removing crucial deterrents to Internet adoption, little will change—and more than 4 billion people may be left behind.

publications.title: Grow fast or die slow
publications.summary: Software and online-services companies can quickly become billion-dollar giants, but the recipe for sustained growth remains elusive.

publications.title: Next-generation IT infrastructure
publications.source: McKinsey's Latest Thinking on Business Technology
publications.summary: IT infrastructure leaders are excited about the prospect of the next generation of IT infrastructure, but they are proceeding with caution.

publications.title: The enterprise IT infrastructure agenda for 2014
publications.summary: IT infrastructure managers must simultaneously capture the next rounds of efficiencies, accelerate the transition to next-generation infrastructure, reduce risks, and improve organizational execution.

publications.title: Growing Software Companies into Billion Dollar Giants
publications.summary: Software is no longer designated to a single industry—it has become embedded in the processes of every company going forward.  How, then, does a company achieve scale and sustained high growth in a time where creating a company can require only a week?  What are the phases seen in high growth companies, and what traits do they share?

publications.title: Protecting information in the cloud
publications.summary:
High quality global journalism requires investment. Please share this article with others using the link below, do not cut & paste the article. See our Ts&Cs and Copyright Policy for more detail. Email ftsales.support@ft.com to buy additional rights. http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/071d1b3c-5514-11e2-a220-00144feab49a.html#ixzz2HKAmXVRw

As attractive as cloud environments are, they also come with new types of risks. Executives are asking whether external providers can protect sensitive data and also ensure compliance with regulations about where certain data can be stored and who can access the data. Chief information officers (CIOs) and chief risk officers (CROs) are also asking whether building private clouds creates a single point of vulnerability by aggregating many different types of sensitive data onto a single platform.

publications.title: Where the cloud is likely to grow
publications.summary: The shift to the cloud will hapen sooner than many think. Two-thirds of corporate applications once considered too risky or complex to move will be part of the migration, IT executives say.

publications.title: Getting ahead in the cloud
publications.summary: The transition to cloud computing will be especially challenging for governments, given their myriad IT systems and their security, budgetary, and organizational constraints. We look at four critical actions they must take.

publications.title: The silver lining: Large enterprises venture into cloud computing
publications.summary: Cloud computing has become a real option for many organizations seeking greater efficiency and more flexibility from IT. Even large enterprises stand to benefit greatly from adopting cloud services, but how can they navigate this challenging transition in the face of complex legacy IT systems and regulations?

publications.title: Using technology to improve workforce collaboration
publications.summary: Knowledge workers fuel innovation and growth, yet the nature of knowledge work remains poorly understood—as do the ways to improve its effectiveness. This article shares our research on how technology can improve the quality and output of knowledge workers.

publications.title: Structured Datatype Expansion Framework
publications.summary: One embodiment of the present invention provides a system that expands a symbolic representation of a data item into a locale-specific textual representation of the data item. The system operates by first receiving a locale-independent symbolic representation of the data item. Next, the system obtains a locale attribute that identifies a version of a language that is spoken in a locale, and then expands this symbolic representation of the data item into the locale-specific textual representation of the data item.

publications.title: Eight business technology trends to watch
publications.summary: Technology alone is rarely the key to unlocking economic value: companies create real wealth when they combine technology with new ways of doing business. Through our work and research, we have identified eight technology-enabled trends that will help shape businesses and the economy in coming years. These trends fall within three broad areas of business activity: managing relationships, managing capital and assets, and leveraging information in new ways.

publications.title: Method and Apparatus for Providing Speech Recognition Resolution On An Application Server
publications.summary: A method of providing speech recognition resolution on an application server in a communication network includes receiving an utterance from an end-user, for example, at a Voice Gateway in response to a prompt by an application prompt, capturing the utterance, and dispatching it via the application server to a speech recognition provider. The method further includes performing item-matching via a search algorithm, returning items matching the utterance to the application server, and returning relevant utterance matches to the application, for example, on the Voice Gateway, for communication to the user.

jobTitle: Executive Director of Project Management Operations

experiences.title: Executive Director of Project Management Operations
Senior Director Project Planning and Management
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsible for setting the strategic vision/direction and takes overall responsibility for Project Planning & Management (PPM), a division of the Therapeutic Device Program Management (TDPM) department. This position drives on time, high quality project delivery through strategic use of PPM resources. This position also supports RFPs through assisting proposal and budget development, and as necessary assumes the responsibility of Operational Delivery Leader and Customer Engagement Manager. Duties include divisional oversight and budget management, global career development strategy, leadership of Associate Project Managers (APM), and the direct-line supervision of managers of the global PPM Team (Project Specialists and Project Administrators) 
inclusive of skills assessments, oversight, training, mentoring, performance evaluation, career 
development, strategic resourcing, and utilization.

experiences.title: Director, Project Management
experiences.jobDescription: The Director of Project Management takes overall responsibility for line management of assigned project manager and/or project director staff including collaboration with the global resourcing team on assignments as well as activity and metrics reporting. The Director also ensures that the client's goals of time, cost, and quality performance are met. The Director may also act as the senior liaison with, and may have overall responsibility for assigned clients.

experiences.title: Director of Clinical Management
experiences.jobDescription: Responsible for the global leadership of the Clinical Management group. Key components include the direct resource management and supervision of line management within the Clinical Management group. Oversight includes: skills assessment, training, resourcing support, performance evaluation and career development. Requires close collaboration with Project Management and Resourcing to ensure project execution and completion in accordance with contractual agreements, Good Clinical Practice (GCP), and regulations. Provides leadership in the implementation of operational management activities globally and participates in the development and revision of Clinical Management global policies.

experiences.title: Associate Director of Project Management
experiences.jobDescription: Helping to ensure customers meet their time, cost, and quality goals through direct line management of Project Managers as well as through providing senior oversight to assigned projects. Additional responsibilities include ensuring adequate resourcing of projects, triage request for proposals, and leading the implementation of new systems and processes.

experiences.title: Senior Manager, Project Management Support Group
experiences.jobDescription:
An experienced Global Clinical Project Manager providing direct-line supervision of the Project Management Support Team comprised of approximately 25 Project Management Professionals in the United States across 3 office locations. Responsibilities include oversight, training, mentoring, performance evaluation and career development. 

Additional responsibilities include participating in the development and implementation of policies and procedures in collaboration with various departments company-wide for the successful integration of updates in accordance with SOPs, Good Clinical Practice, and regulations.  Provides leadership in the implementation of operational management activities and participates in the development and revision of policies.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jilly Turner
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Head, Project Management Office
recommendationsReceived.context: Jilly reported directly to Robert
recommendationsReceived.description:
I have had the pleasure of working with Rob and I can confidently say they are an exceptional Executive Director of Project Management
.
Rob brings a rare combination of strategic vision and hands-on delivery expertise. Their calm, decisive leadership inspires confidence at executive and board level, even in highly pressured environments.
What truly sets Rob apart is their people-centred approach. They build and lead high-performing teams, foster a culture of accountability and collaboration, and mentor senior leaders to achieve their best. 
Rob has an unwavering commitment to quality, outcomes, and continuous improvement, and they consistently deliver results that align with organisational strategy and long-term value. They are a trusted leader, a strategic thinker, and a delivery expert.

I would not hesitate to recommend Rob to any organisation seeking an Executive Director who can drive transformation, deliver at scale, and lead with integrity.

recommendations.name: Taylor Willard, MBA
recommendations.subtitle: Global Category Manager
recommendations.description:
It is my pleasure to recommend Taylor Willard, whom I had the privilege of managing during her time in the project management support team at Premier Research. I worked with Taylor approximately eight years ago, and even then, she stood out as an exceptionally capable and motivated professional.

When Taylor joined the team, she quickly demonstrated a keen ability to understand the complexities of clinical trial management, navigate challenges with ease, and foster productive collaboration across multidisciplinary teams. Her attention to detail and ability to prioritize and execute tasks effectively were instrumental in the smooth running of several clinical trials during her tenure.

Within a relatively short time, Taylor distinguished herself by consistently exceeding expectations within her role. Her proactive attitude, strong problem-solving skills, and ability to build trust with sponsors, stakeholders, and team members made her an invaluable asset. It was no surprise that she was quickly promoted to Project Manager after proving her competency for the role.

I have no doubt that she will continue to excel in her career. Please reach out if you have further questions regarding our time working together. 

Robert Weldon

recommendations.name: Jilly Turner
recommendations.subtitle: Head, Project Management Office
recommendations.description: I highly recommend Jilly Turner, who has been an invaluable member of my team at Premier Research as a Director of Project Launch for the past 7 years. During this time, she demonstrated exceptional expertise in managing clinical trials as well as a keen ability to lead and manage her department effectively.  The Project Lauch department's engagement, retention, and performance consistently exceeded expectations.  This was due to her ability to select the right candidates, effectively train and mentor, and support their career development goals.  Jilly has also supported initiatives to improve the company and created or updated SOPs to enhance processes within the organization.

updates.postText:
Data-Driven Storytelling: How AI Rescued My Sales Strategy (And Can Rescue Yours Too)

Confession time: I used to think my trusty PowerPoint deck was unstoppable—so persuasive, it could sell snow to a snowman. 

Every client, every meeting: same slides, same pitch, same bored faces. Then came the day I pitched to a CFO who looked like she’d rather watch paint dry. I was on autopilot, until desperation nudged me to mention a fresh industry trend I’d read about that morning. 

Suddenly, she sat up, fired off questions, and—just like that—we had a real conversation. Deal closed. 

Lesson learned: Stories tailored to your audience actually matter. If you’ve ever watched a promising prospect mentally check out during your pitch, you know the pain of generic messaging. It’s like showing up at a masquerade in sweatpants—forgettable and definitely not a contender for best dressed.

Buyers can spot a cookie-cutter approach instantly. Miss the mark, and your message fades into the background, like elevator music no one remembers.  I needed something to help us break through the noise—a secret weapon.

Enter AI: Your Data-Driven Storytelling Sidekick

Not the sci-fi, take-over-the-world kind of AI—the helpful, data-crunching kind that helps you sound more human, not less. 

We let AI dig into mountains of buyer data—who they are, what they care about, what keeps them up at night.

But here’s the secret sauce: AI delivers the insights, but it’s your team’s creativity that turns them into memorable stories.

Think of AI as the sous chef, prepping the best ingredients. Your people are the chefs, crafting the perfect dish. Instead of the usual “here’s how awesome our product is!” approach, we started sharing stories about real businesses and real impact. Engagement soared.

Buyers want to hear about their challenges, not just your features. We shifted our narrative, and suddenly, we weren’t just another vendor—we became trusted partners. That big deal? Signed, sealed, and delivered—with a little extra on top.

I’m not claiming AI is some magic wand, but it’s a powerful flashlight when you’re lost in a maze of buyer uncertainty.

AI is your GPS—you still have to drive the car. The best stories blend data and heart, and trust me, it’s way more effective than reciting the same tired deck.

Sales Has Changed: Are You Keeping Up?  
Success in sales depends less on what you say and more on how you make people feel. This is where Emotional Intelligence (EI) becomes your ultimate advantage. It is not just another buzzword—it is the competitive edge that separates good sales professionals from exceptional ones.

Here is a 5-step Emotional Intelligence framework—designed to help you stand out, build trust, and drive meaningful results.

The 5-Step Emotional Intelligence Framework for Sales Success
1. Master Self-Awareness: Set the Right Tone
The most exceptional sales professionals know that success begins with self-awareness. Before every interaction, ask yourself:
What energy am I bringing into this conversation?
Am I calm, confident, and focused—or stressed and distracted?
Quick Tip: Before your next call or meeting, take a moment to reset. Whether it is a deep breath, or a pause to refocus, being mindful of your emotional state can make all the difference.

2. Build Trust Through Empathy
Empathy is more than just a skill—it is the foundation of every successful relationship. When you take the time to truly understand your prospect’s challenges, goals, and pain points, you stop being just another salesperson and start becoming a trusted partner.
Quick Tip: During your next conversation, try reflecting back what your prospect says. For example:
“It sounds like your biggest challenge right now is…”
“I can tell how frustrating [specific pain point] must be for you.”

3. Speak Without Words: Master Non-Verbal Communication
Did you know that 93% of communication is non-verbal? Your tone, body language, and facial expressions send powerful signals to your prospects.
Quick Tip: Pay attention to these non-verbal cues:
Posture: Are you sitting upright and engaged, or slumped and distracted?
Tone: Does your voice convey warmth, confidence, and enthusiasm?
Facial Expressions: Are you smiling (even during virtual calls)?

4. Navigate Objections with Emotional Intelligence
Objections are inevitable, but how you handle them defines your ability to close the deal. Emotional Intelligence helps you approach objections with calm, patience, and creativity.
Quick Tip: When faced with an objection, follow this 3-step process:
Acknowledge: “That is a great point. I can understand why you might feel that way.”
Clarify: “Can you share more about what’s behind this concern?”
Solve: Offer a solution tailored to their specific needs.

5. Strengthen Relationships with Post-Sale Care
The real work begins after the deal closes. Emotional Intelligence does not stop when the contract is signed. Building loyalty, retaining clients, and turning customers into advocates requires ongoing care. 
Quick Tip: After a sale, schedule a follow-up email or call—not to pitch anything, but simply to check in. Ask:
“How are things going with [product/service]?”
“Is there anything else I can help you with?”

What strategies have worked for you, and what challenges have you faced?

Sales and Marketing Strategy: The Chess Game of Business Success 
Imagine standing over a chessboard, carefully planning your next move. Every decision matters. Do you play offensively, aiming to dominate the board, or defensively, protecting your position?
But here’s the real question: Are you approaching sales and marketing like a chess game—or just winging it?


The Challenge: Disconnected Moves Lead to Lost Games
One of the biggest mistakes in business is treating sales and marketing as separate silos instead of a unified force working toward a shared goal.

Here’s what happens when there’s no alignment:
• Missed Opportunities: Marketing generates high-quality leads, but sales doesn’t have the tools or strategy to nurture and close them.
• Short-Term Thinking: Sales focuses on immediate wins, ignoring the long-term brand-building foundation laid by marketing.
 
It’s like playing chess without a strategy: moving pieces aimlessly and hoping for the best. Without a cohesive plan, your business risks falling into “checkmate.”
To win the game, you need alignment, foresight, and a clear strategy.

Actionable Insights: Play the Game Strategically
If you want your sales and marketing efforts to work in harmony—like a well-played chess game—here are five strategic moves to implement:

1. Start with the Endgame in Mind
Great chess players visualize checkmate before making their first move. Similarly, your teams must align on shared goals. Whether it’s boosting ROI or expanding market share having a clear endgame ensures everyone is working toward the same vision.

2. Position Your Pieces (Your Team and Tools)
Every chess piece has a role. Marketing is your opening strategy (creating awareness, like pawns advancing), while sales makes the decisive moves (queens and rooks closing deals). Invest in tools like CRMs and analytics platforms to ensure seamless collaboration across teams.

3. Anticipate Your Opponent’s Moves
Chess champions study their opponents. Your teams should do the same—study your audience and competitors. Use data to predict customer pain points, objections, and preferences. The better your understanding, the sharper your strategy.

4. Adapt and Pivot Mid-Game
No chess match or business strategy goes perfectly as planned. Monitor your campaigns and sales performance closely. If something isn’t working, be agile. Pivoting strategically can often mean the difference between winning and losing.

5. Play the Long Game
Chess isn’t won in a single move, and neither is customer loyalty. Marketing builds trust and awareness over time, while sales delivers personalized value-driven interactions. Together, they create a sustainable growth engine for long-term success.

Are You Playing to Win?
Sales and marketing, like chess, require strategy, collaboration, and patience. When these two forces align, your business becomes a powerhouse.
Drop your strategies in the comments below.

From Pain Points to Solutions: A Salesperson’s Guide to Delivering Value
To succeed, sales professionals must move beyond selling and become trusted problem solvers who deeply understand and address their clients’ unique challenges. Here’s how:

Why Pain Points Matter
Pain points are the daily frustrations, inefficiencies, or obstacles your clients face. 
💥When you solve these pain points, you become a trusted advisor. Ignore them, and your pitch risks becoming irrelevant.

Step 1️⃣: Identify Client Needs
A successful sales presentation starts with understanding your client’s priorities and challenges.
a) Do Your Homework
Research their company, industry, and competitors before the meeting. Look for:
Trends or challenges impacting their business.
Insights from their website, press releases, or LinkedIn.
b) Ask Open-Ended Questions
Strategic questions reveal challenges and goals. Examples:
“What obstacles are preventing you from achieving your goals?”
“How does your team define success this quarter?”
“What tools or processes aren’t meeting expectations?”
These questions uncover pain points while showing genuine interest in their success.
c) Actively Listen
Active listening is a sales superpower. Pay attention to verbal and non-verbal cues—like frustration about inefficiencies or enthusiasm about goals—to guide your pitch.

Step 2️⃣: Provide Tailored Solutions
Once you’ve identified pain points, position your product or service as the solution.
a) Customize Your Presentation
Generic presentations won’t cut it. Tailor your pitch to their specific challenges. For example:
If inefficiencies are the issue, show how your solution streamlines processes.
If costs are a concern, highlight ROI and long-term savings.
Use case studies or real-world examples to help them visualize the impact of your solution.
b) Focus on Benefits, Not Features
Clients care about outcomes, not technical details. Frame your product in terms of value. For example:
Instead of, “Our software automates reporting,” say, “Our software reduces reporting time by 50%, freeing up your team for strategic work.”
Highlight how your solution directly addresses their pain points and drives results.
c) Address Objections Early
Objections are natural—address them proactively.
If cost is a concern, explain ROI and long-term value.
If implementation feels daunting, outline your onboarding process and support resources.
Proactively tackling objections builds trust and confidence in your solution.

Final Thoughts: Empathy Is Your Greatest Tool
💥Sales isn’t about flashy pitches—it’s about empathy. Clients don’t buy products. They buy solutions to their problems and outcomes that make their lives easier.

How Pixar’s Storytelling Principles Can Transform Your Sales Strategy

Every sale begins with a story. And when it comes to storytelling, Pixar has mastered the art of creating emotional and compelling narratives. Pixar’s storytelling magic isn’t just for movies—it’s a game-changer for sales.

Sales isn’t just about pitching a product. It’s about building trust, creating emotional connections, and helping your prospects see themselves as the hero of the story. 

1. Your Prospect Is the Hero 
Pixar’s stories always center around a relatable hero who faces challenges and embarks on a journey. In sales, your prospect is the hero, not your product.

Sales Lesson: Frame your pitch around your prospect’s challenges and goals. Instead of focusing on what your product does, focus on how it helps them overcome their struggles. “You’re juggling multiple tasks, and it’s overwhelming. Imagine having a tool that simplifies your day and gives you back hours of your time.”

When your prospect sees themselves in the story, they’re more likely to engage.

2. Introduce the Conflict
Every Pixar movie has a conflict that drives the story forward. In sales, the conflict is the problem your prospect is facing.

Sales Lesson: Highlight the pain points your prospect is experiencing. Be specific. “Your team is spending 10 hours a week manually entering data, which is slowing down your growth.”

When you articulate the problem clearly, your prospect will feel understood.

3. Be the Guide, Not the Hero
In Pixar movies, the hero doesn’t succeed alone—they have a guide. In sales, you’re the guide who helps your prospect overcome their challenges.

Sales Lesson: Position your product as the tool that empowers your prospect to succeed. Show them how it solves their problem and leads to their desired outcome. “With our software, you’ll eliminate manual data entry, save 10 hours a week, and focus on growing your business.”

Your role is to guide them toward success, not to take the spotlight.

4. Use Emotion to Drive Action
Pixar’s stories are emotional. Why? Because emotion drives action. The same is true in sales.

Sales Lesson: Don’t just rely on logic and data—tap into your prospect’s emotions. Use vivid language to describe the relief they’ll feel when they achieve their goals. “Imagine the relief of knowing your team has everything they need to succeed, without the stress of manual processes.”

Emotion creates a connection, and connection drives decisions.

5. Show the Transformation
Pixar movies always end with a transformation. In sales, the transformation is the outcome your prospect achieves with your product.

Sales Lesson: Paint a clear picture of the “before and after.” “Before using our solution, one of our clients struggled to meet deadlines. After implementing it, they reduced project delays by 30% and increased customer satisfaction by 20%.”

When your prospect can visualize the transformation, they’ll be more motivated to take action.

I had the pleasure of managing Rich during my tenure as Chief Revenue Officer at ClinicMind, and I can confidently say he is a dedicated and competent professional.

Rich consistently demonstrated an exceptional work ethic, always going above and beyond to ensure our team’s success. He approached every project with a positive attitude and a willingness to tackle even the most complex challenges head-on. His attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality results made him a standout contributor on our team.

What truly sets Rich apart is his ability to quickly adapt to new situations and learn on the fly. Whether we were rolling out new SaaS solutions, optimizing sales processes, or navigating the fast-paced demands of a growing organization, Rich was always proactive, resourceful, and reliable. He not only met expectations but often exceeded them, taking initiative to identify opportunities for improvement and driving projects forward with minimal oversight.

Rich’s collaborative spirit and strong communication skills made him a valued team member, and his professionalism earned the respect of colleagues across departments. I have no doubt that Rich will continue to excel and make a significant impact wherever he goes.

I highly recommend Rich to any organization looking for a hardworking, skilled, and dependable team player.

recommendations.name: Sonja Bracey
recommendations.subtitle: Account Manager & Customer Success Leader | SaaS Sales Specialist | Driving Retention, Software Adoption & Growth | Workflow Optimization & Client Relationships
recommendations.description:
It is with genuine enthusiasm that I recommend Sonja as an outstanding Customer Success and SaaS Sales Specialist. During her time reporting to me, Sonja consistently distinguished herself through her unwavering client focus, strong technical skills, and impressive sales expertise, making her an invaluable part of the team.

Sonja is a results-driven, proactive professional who thrives in dynamic SaaS environments. She approaches every client interaction with a consultative mindset, consistently delivers results, and is deeply dedicated to enhancing both customer satisfaction and company success.

Sonja excels at driving client growth and satisfaction, seamlessly aligning customer needs with strategic business objectives. She designed and executed tailored onboarding strategies that resulted in exceptional software adoption rates during the critical early days—demonstrating both her strategic insight and meticulous attention to detail. Her engaging and personalized training sessions empowered clients to maximize the value of our platform, leading to improved operational efficiency and consistently positive feedback.

One of Sonja’s standout strengths is her ability to proactively identify at-risk accounts and implement targeted solutions. This proactive approach not only reduced churn but also led to significant year-over-year improvements in client retention. Sonja leverages data-driven analysis to monitor key performance indicators, refine processes, and drive continuous improvement, ensuring our efforts were always aligned with both customer and business goals.

Her collaborative spirit shines in her work with cross-functional teams—including product, support, and sales—where she played a crucial role in enhancing the onboarding process and efficiently resolving complex client issues with professionalism and care.
