I am pleased to provide a reference for Phly Jambor, who I had the privilege of supervising for five years. During this time, Phly consistently demonstrated exceptional skills and a strong work ethic that significantly contributed to our team's success. 

Phly is a remarkable professional with an impressive ability to communicate effectively and collaborate with colleagues across various departments. Her interpersonal skills create a positive work atmosphere, making her a trusted resource for team collaboration and problem-solving. 

One of Phly's standout qualities is her analytical thinking. She approaches challenges with a strategic mindset, enabling her to devise solutions that are both innovative and practical. Her meticulous attention to detail ensures that projects are executed flawlessly, and her adaptability in a fast-paced environment has proven invaluable. 

In addition to her analytical skills, Phly is highly proficient in project management. She has successfully led numerous projects from start to finish, demonstrating her capability to manage timelines, resources, and team dynamics effectively. 

Beyond her professional abilities, Phly embodies integrity and dedication. She is always willing to go the extra mile to support her colleagues and contribute to the overall success of the organization. 

I am confident that Phly will excel in any role she pursues in the future. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any opportunity she seeks. Her unique blend of skills, experience, and personal qualities makes her an invaluable asset to any team.

headline: VP Manufacturing Executive | Scaling $15-50M Operations | Lean Turnaround & Profitability Specialist | Inc. 5000 Growth
addressWithCountry: Greater Saginaw-Midland-Bay City Area, United States
about:
About

Dynamic servant leader with 20+ years driving growth in $15–50M manufacturing firms. As General Manager, VP of Manufacturing and Entrepreneur, I’ve built operations, led turnarounds, and owned P&L and board-level strategy, fostering mentorship-driven cultures. Six Sigma Black Belt, LEAN Champion, and manufacturing process patent holder (#8256661).

Recognized for helping lead an Inc. 5000 manufacturing company from startup to national recognition through disciplined execution, process alignment, and team-driven growth. A former Chairman and current Executive Team Member of the Grand Traverse Area Manufacturing Council, I remain deeply engaged in advancing northern Michigan’s manufacturing community—promoting collaboration, workforce development, and innovation to strengthen the region’s industrial base.

Key Achievements

* General Manager at H.B. Carbide ($40M): Drove 50% RMA reduction, 15% OTD improvement, and 30% capacity growth via $2M automation, building a high-engagement culture.
* VP at TentCraft: Built manufacturing from a $4M reseller to $20M+ domestic operation (Inc. 5000 #2560), designing processes, buying equipment, hiring 100+ employees, and cutting lead times by 80%.
* VP/equity partner at Promethient: Improved margins by 30% and built supply chains for $18M growth.
* Director at Armor Express: Led $25M turnaround, boosting OTD from 5% to 85%.
* Founded/exited MyRaceNumber ($250K/year) and GRIT (profitable in <1 year).

Leadership Philosophy

Drive servant leadership by engaging and empowering teams to excel at work and beyond. I design org charts with optimal coach-to-player ratios to foster mentorship, relationship-building, and a thriving culture, drawing from my experience as a two-time Michigan Motocross State Champion and youth baseball coach to instill competitive drive and personal growth.

Core Expertise

* Lean manufacturing and operational turnarounds
* P&L management and board-level strategic planning, utilizing Scaling Up and EOS Traction models to set objectives, pivot, and adapt for scalable growth
* Supply chain optimization and market diversification
* Mentorship-driven team leadership and organizational design
* Automation and manufacturing modernization
* Business development and sales strategies, including identifying new products and revenue channels
* Marketing strategies, managing Google AdWords, Facebook campaigns, print publications, and trade shows to build a customer base of +20,000 customers.

Proud to advance Michigan’s manufacturing legacy through innovative operations and community-focused leadership.

experiences.title: General Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Lead all aspects of a $30M precision manufacturing operation’s transformation:

* Own P&L, budgeting, forecasting, and strategic development to drive EBITDA growth and profitability.
* Develop capital expenditure plans, including facilities and maintenance investments, to meet ROI objectives.
* Lead organizational transformation using EOS/Traction methodology to enhance team performance and engagement.
* Implemented EOS Level 10 meetings to align teams and execute goals.
* Lead business planning, including SWOT & STEP analysis to define strategic objectives.
* Report to the board and present strategic business plan and monthly updates, ensuring alignment with goals.
* Drive sales growth through process innovation, product diversification, and industry expansion.
* Identify and eliminate unprofitable product lines to protect margins.
* Lead performance improvement initiatives to resolve issues and recover targets.
* Grow EBITDA % despite economic challenges by optimizing operational costs.
* Reduced customer returns/RMAs by 50%, improving satisfaction.
* Increased On-Time Delivery (OTD) by 15% through improved scheduling and capacity planning.
* Improved plant operations and labor efficiency by 20% through restructuring, KPI development, CAPEX for automation, and accountability.
* Fostered a culture of safety, achieving >2 years without a lost-time incident.
* Developed a high-performing multi-level leadership team to engage employees and build a strong culture.
* Secured ~ $100k in grants for LEAN, 5S, and leadership training.
* Established new KPIs for safety, quality, cost, delivery, and process improvements.
* Executed a $2M facility expansion with automation increasing capacity by 30%.
* Developing a business plan to expand business unit, including sales strategy, building acquisition, and CAPEX for facility upgrades and new equipment.
* Leading office automation with software, RPA, and AI to improve order accuracy and streamline processing.

headline: Executive Leader | Building High-Performance Teams & Scalable Systems | Operational Excellence, Culture, and Long-Term Value Creation
about:
I’ve learned that great leadership is built on systems — not slogans. Systems that create clarity, enable accountability, and allow people to perform at their highest level when the pressure is on.

Leading teams in complex, high-risk environments has taught me that execution excellence is never accidental. It’s the result of alignment, rhythm, and disciplined leadership. My focus is helping organizations scale leadership, not just output — delivering operational reliability, cultural strength, and financial performance in equal measure.

My Leadership Framework
	1.	Clarity over complexity – Confusion is expensive. The best leaders simplify direction until everyone understands why the work matters.
	2.	Culture is a system, not a slogan – Values don’t live on walls; they live in behavior. Culture becomes real when it’s designed, measured, and reinforced daily.
	3.	Accountability creates freedom – Accountability isn’t control; it’s ownership. Empowered teams make faster, smarter decisions when they know what success looks like.
	4.	Process protects performance – Discipline wins when stakes are high. Systems and routines keep teams consistent when conditions change.
	5.	Calm is a competitive advantage – Pressure exposes preparation. Great leaders create stability by modeling composure when it matters most.

My work centers on leadership systems, operational strategy, scalable performance, culture development, and cross-industry growth execution — all grounded in disciplined financial performance and long-term value creation.

Ultimately, my purpose is to help organizations build operational cultures that last — the kind that deliver consistent results across industries, borders, and generations of leaders

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
Founded and scaled a performance-driven infrastructure services company delivering mission-critical utility and energy solutions. Built multi-state operations focused on safety, reliability, and disciplined execution.

Led organizational growth from startup to sustained profitability through a leadership framework centered on operational excellence, cultural alignment, and financial accountability. Developed systems that improved efficiency, reduced cost variance, and enhanced field performance across large-scale infrastructure projects.

Key areas of focus: operational strategy, team development, customer alignment, and integration within Thayer Infrastructure Services as part of a multi-division enterprise expansion.

experiences.title: Co-Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
Co-founded a healthcare safety startup that revolutionized patient handling systems through innovation, training, and operational design. Focused on building scalable systems that connected technology, education, and human performance to reduce injury and improve safety outcomes.

Designed organizational structures and compliance frameworks that supported operational excellence, fiscal discipline, and sustainable service delivery. Collaborated with healthcare and regulatory partners to align culture, process, and technology for measurable impact.

experiences.title: Director of Operations
experiences.jobDescription:
Directed multi-site operations during a critical growth phase, building the foundation for scalable systems and sustainable performance. Established operational frameworks that improved quality, compliance, and efficiency across multiple healthcare environments.

Implemented standardized processes and performance metrics to drive accountability and ensure consistency across client facilities. Partnered with leadership teams to align culture, systems, and outcomes, setting the stage for rapid expansion and long-term organizational stability.

experiences.title: Rotary Wing Pilot
experiences.jobDescription:
Led missions in complex, high-pressure environments requiring precision, adaptability, and accountability. Directed platoon-level operations, coordinated logistics, and maintained readiness across teams operating under strict performance and safety standards.

Developed leadership skills rooted in structured decision-making, situational awareness, and disciplined execution — principles that continue to inform operational strategy and team culture in corporate environments.

experiences.title: Guidance Counselor
experiences.jobDescription:
Directed recruitment and career development programs for Army National Guard personnel, managing end-to-end processes from candidate assessment through enlistment and retention. Designed outreach and evaluation systems to align individual potential with mission-critical organizational needs.

Developed communication and leadership frameworks that strengthened unit cohesion, improved retention, and enhanced workforce readiness. Gained foundational experience in people systems — identifying, developing, and aligning talent to achieve strategic objectives.

experiences.title: Signal NCO
experiences.jobDescription:
Led communication and IT systems operations for the Effects Coordination Cell, supporting mission-critical functions across multi-unit deployments. Managed teams responsible for implementing, securing, and maintaining complex communication networks under demanding field conditions.

Developed deep expertise in systems reliability, process standardization, and team coordination — building the foundation for a leadership approach centered on structure, accountability, and operational discipline.

updates.postText:
I didn’t sell because demand slowed.

I sold because the balance sheet became the ceiling.

Some of the richest founders don’t run trendy businesses.

They run dirty ones. Risky, unglamorous, the kind most people won’t touch. That work pays when your standards hold.

What I got wrong early was thinking more revenue meant more value.

It doesn’t, not if margin quality and risk control are flat.

I could feel it happening in real time.
Jobs were booked, crews were moving, customers were calling.

But underwriting was tightening, exposure was growing, and one bad month could erase a year of “growth.”

That’s when I learned the quiet rule.

Don’t confuse volume with value when your margin and risk aren’t improving.

Built to Sell Radio dropped our episode today.

If you’re building in an unglamorous lane, this will feel familiar.

#Leadership #Operations #Entrepreneurship #PracticalGrit

The Leadership Trap

I used to punish my best crew with trust.

It’s the Leadership Trap: you optimize for outcomes, but the “hard job tax” gets paid by the same people or crew every time.

When a job was ugly, I sent my best guys. Every time. The weaker crews got the easier work, and I told myself it was the only way to protect the outcome.

I told my best crew the truth: you are my best. I can’t send the other guys.

But I also did something subtle that broke fairness. I stopped holding them to the same production standard because I knew that job was hard just to finish clean.

That is how great crews burn out. Not from work, but from carrying everyone else’s standard.

What fixed it was a simple rule: hard jobs rotate, and hard jobs get paid back.

Same behaviors expected from every crew. Different production targets based on job difficulty.

And weak crews don’t get hidden on easy work. They get coached up or coached out.

The fastest way to spot the Leadership Trap is to look at who gets the hardest work and who gets the most grace.

#Leadership #Operations #Execution #Construction #PracticalGrit

The Promotion Trap: When a Good  Foreman Becomes a Bad Manager

If you want to kill a productive crew,
promote the foreman before you’ve ever trained them to lead.

I’ve done it.

We all have.

On Friday he’s your best hand.

On Monday he’s buried in paperwork, babysitting drama, and getting yelled at for numbers he doesn’t control.

The crew slows down, he feels like he’s failing, and you wonder where your “rockstar” went.

That’s the promotion trap:
we reward performance and pretend it’s the same as readiness.

Here’s what I’ve learned the hard way:

• The work that got you the promotion is not the work that keeps you in the role.

• A title without training doesn’t build leaders, it builds resentment.

• Every time you skip grooming the next level, you tax the whole job with confusion and rework.

In our world, “ready” has to mean more than being the best at the craft:

• Ready = can run the day without you in the room.

• Ready = can have one hard conversation without blowing someone up.

• Ready = can protect the standard when the schedule gets ugly.

A promotion shouldn’t be a test.

It should be proof they’ve already been doing the job.

Practical move for the next 90 days:

	1.	Pick one foreman you’re thinking about moving up.

	2.	Give them one “promotion day” a week: they run the board, the 1:1s, and one tough call.

	3.	If they can do that for 90 days, the title is just catching up to reality.

Practical Grit lives in that gap between great trades and real leadership.

Where have you seen the promotion trap show up on your jobs?

#Leadership #PracticalGrit #Execution #Trades #Construction

headline: Strategist | Operations | Innovator
about:
I am a dynamic professional with a knack for identifying and capitalizing on strategic opportunities across diverse business sectors. With extensive and rich experience, I have perfected the art of team coordination, executive customer engagement, and business analysis. My mission is to create unparalleled value for clients and stakeholders, thriving in environments that foster collaboration and innovation.

My core strengths lie in strategic business development, technological strategy, and the ability to adapt business processes to ever-changing landscapes. I dive deep into business processes to uncover and optimize strengths, driving growth and success. Committed to continuous learning and professional development, I ensure the organizations I support not only succeed but excel.

headline:

jobTitle: Osani Quality Consulting, LLC. - Managing Director
about: Highly accomplished cGMP professional with 32+ years driving quality and compliance in the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, and API industries. Proven leader in complex projects, ensuring regulatory adherence and continuous improvement through expertise in QMS, risk management, and audits. Proficient in TrackWise and other industry-standard software.

experiences.title: Osani Quality Consulting, LLC. - Managing Director
experiences.jobDescription:
Osani Quality Consulting, LLC. | Managing Director | 2011 – Present
• Provided cGMP consulting services to pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical companies, delivering quality, compliance, and efficiency across various projects. 
• Key achievements in contract roles (see details below): 
◦ Authored over 50 procedures (Eli Lilly).
◦ Reduced deviation backlogs by up to 90% (i.e., Novartis and Plastikon Healthcare). 
◦ Authored and implemented over sixty (60) cGMP-compliant QMS procedures (i.e., Akron Biotechnology). 
◦ Completed over 860 deviation investigations, ensuring timely resolution and regulatory adherence (i.e.,    Regeneron). 
◦ Conducted eight (8) CD baseline inspection audits, identifying and mitigating compliance gaps (i.e., McNeil/JnJ). 
◦ Trained staff on GMPs, procedures, and FDA regulations (i.e., Celltrion and ImprimisRx).

experiences.title: Other (below)
experiences.jobDescription:
Caraco Labs | Associate Director, QA Systems and Compliance | 2011 – 2012
    • Managed all QA department functions, including batch release, document control, stability, investigations,  CAPA, training, and supplier quality. 
Impax Labs | Senior Manager, Regulatory Site Compliance | 2008 – 2011
    • Managed compliance efforts across multiple sites, including audits, Quality Agreements, and regulatory readiness for inspections. 
Poly Peptide Labs | Plant QA Manager | 2007 – 2008
    • Managed all QA functions, including batch release, document control, investigations, CAPA, internal audits, and training.

headline: Simplifying AI, personal growth, & business | Entrepreneur | Writer | AI & GTM Advisor | Keynote Speaker | Personal Branding | 250K+ Multi-Platform Reach
about:
For brand collaboration: sufyanmaan.w@gmail.com

Hi, I'm Sufyan. 

I help founders, executives, and creators to unlock growth at the intersection of AI, business strategy, and personal branding. 

With 10+ years leading GTM, product management, and innovation initiatives across telecom, e-commerce, edtech, transportation, and energy, I now empower startups, creators, and entrepreneurs to:

▪ Build online businesses and scale audience on LinkedIn
▪ Leverage AI for business and personal growth
▪ Go from idea to market fit with proven GTM strategies

WHAT SETS ME APART?

▪ Founder of 'The Pathway', a newsletter with global readers on personal growth, AI, & business innovation
▪ Angel investor in 7+ startups across transportation, AI, ClimatTech, & HealthTech
▪ Top writer on Medium & Senior Editor
▪ GTM advisor, business coach, and personal branding strategist

I believe in technology as a force multiplier when paired with empathy and intentionality. It can reshape lives and industries. 

MY MISSION:
Help ambitious people and teams realize their full potential in a rapidly changing world

Let's connect if you want to:

▪ Grow your business, influence, or audience
▪ Leverage AI for impact and innovation
▪ Explore collaboration, investment, or coaching

📅 Book 1:1 call: https://tidycal.com/sufyanmaan/60-minute-meeting

→ SUBSCRIBE: The Pathway (https://sufyanmaan.substack.com/)

Connect:
Twitter/X: @sufyanmaan
Medium: @sufyanmaan
Instagram: @sufyanmaan
YouTube: @sufyanmaan

When I'm not writing or building, I'm walking (love long walks) or reading, usually with a black coffee (dark roast).

After building and scaling multiple companies, I transitioned into GTM advisory and consulting, helping startups navigate the path from idea to market success.

Go-To-Market Advisory & Consulting– I help startup founders go from MVP to product-market fit and scale with proven GTM strategies.  

Personal Branding & LinkedIn Growth—I teach professionals how to build an audience, grow a brand, and generate revenue on LinkedIn. My strategies have helped thousands achieve rapid growth and turned audience growth into significant business success.

Helping founders, executives, and creators grow their business, audience, and influence.

recommendationsReceived.description:
Melanie is an excellent leader, able to bridge the gap between the C suite and the front lines of production. As my COO at Dark Heart Nursery, she presented an extremely organized approach to business strategy and her calming level of efficiency was a welcome note in an excited, rapidly growing and sometimes chaotic industry. 
Melanie would be an asset to any company looking for a person who can see the big picture as well as functioning in many, if not all, the roles presented. I saw her go from Sales to Production to the Board Room with a similar level of proficiency, and her ability to move between roles was graceful. She’s a tireless technical thinker on whatever task is before her, as well as being creative and artistic in her interpretation and strategies. I highly recommend Melanie, and you would be lucky to have her on your team.

recommendationsReceived.name: Eric Rosen

recommendationsReceived.context: Eric reported directly to Melanie
recommendationsReceived.description: I had the privilege of serving under Melanie's leadership on two separate occasions in my career. There is no better indicator of effective leadership than the willingness of your team to follow you, especially across multiple companies. Melanie is an exceptional sales and operations leader with a dynamic and charismatic presence. Her profound expertise and deep roots in the CA cannabis industry set her apart. As a supportive leader, she consistently challenges her team(s) to exceed expectations, pushing boundaries and achieving unparalleled results at every level. To this day, Melanie remains a trusted friend and colleague. headline: Featured in Forbes | Executives with big goals need only 5–15 people to unlock momentum. I show them who.
about:
The C-suite has rules no one teaches.

You are expected to move fast, take real risks, and make decisions that follow you for years. Most days, the circle you can actually trust is small.

I know this because I have sat across from more than 10,000 executives as their career coach and recruiter.

Here is what separates the most successful:

They learn how to build, maintain, and leverage trust.

They maximize ROI of their time. 

They invest early in the right relationships and give those people the clear language to advocate for them when it matters.

Everyone else networks at random and ends up busy, burnt out, and unsure why momentum keeps stalling.

At senior levels, outcomes are shaped by an identifiable, small number of relationships, not by effort or visibility alone.

The leaders who move fastest tend to have five types of people in their corner:
	1.	Champions who vouch for them in rooms they are not in
	2.	Connectors who open the right doors at the right time
	3.	Collaborators who sharpen thinking and execution
	4.	Challengers who surface blind spots before they become problems
	5.	Confidants who keep them grounded under pressure

These relationships reduce decision fatigue.
They improve judgment.
They create leverage.

That is my work.

I help executives see the relationship patterns shaping their outcomes, especially the ones that are invisible from the inside.

Over time, this has become a system.

A way to make sense of networks that feel scattered, underused, or stuck.

It is built on a few simple truths:

Not all relationships serve the same purpose.
Influence moves through small trust circles.
Your network can only advocate for you if you have given them the right words.

The system combines:
	•	Five distinct relationship roles
	•	A clear view of your Network’s Networth 
	•	Six dimensions that give your network accurate, referral-ready language
	•	An activation lens that matches the problem to the right relationship

This is not just about expanding your network.

It is about using the trust you already have with more intention.

The leaders I work with stop guessing.
They stop over-indexing on recruiters.
They stop having vague career conversations that go nowhere.

They become easier to name.
Easier to recommend.
Easier to trust.

No noise.
No posturing.
No wasted time.

Just a clear system for turning trust into momentum.

If you want to make better decisions, spend time with people who speak from futures they have already survived.

experiences.title: Founder and CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
Founder and CEO of SuiteC, a curated executive community for senior operators navigating high-stakes decisions, transitions, and growth.

I bring experienced CEOs, CFOs, and CXOs into trusted rooms where hard truths are shared, isolation is reduced, and better decisions happen faster.

SuiteC exists to surface leadership wisdom that is usually locked behind power, privilege, or paywalls and make it accessible through real relationships, not content or theory.

experiences.title: Managing Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Launched and scaled Vaco’s Denver office from zero to profitability in under 12 months.

Worked directly with CEOs, CFOs, and executive teams at $50M to $2B companies on critical hiring decisions, leadership gaps, and growth inflection points.

Built long-term partnerships rooted in trust, not transactions, resulting in repeat business, multi-year client relationships, and a durable executive network.

Led and developed a high-performing team of 12 with a focus on judgment, accountability, and results.

experiences.title: Co Chair, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion Committee
Key Executive Member
experiences.jobDescription:
As a member of a 12-person executive group at Vistage Worldwide, I:
	•	Met other Business Development leaders
	•	Participated in confidential monthly meetings
	•	Engaged in workshops on leadership skills.

After building strong relationships with the 12 people in my group, I chose to step away once I realized I was looking for a more intentionally curated peer community, with deeper alignment around experience, challenges, and career stage. The format was valuable, but it did not fully support the kind of peer relationships I wanted to build.

experiences.title: Managing Director, Executive Search
experiences.jobDescription:
Led C-suite finance and accounting executive searches across direct hire and interim placements.

Consistently ranked as a top national producer by building trust with senior leaders and aligning roles with real business context, not job descriptions.

Connected hundreds of senior finance leaders to roles that matched their strengths, timing, and long-term trajectory.

Built a reputation for straight talk, discretion, and long-term relationships.

recommendationsReceived.description:
I am delighted to recommend Bea Sonnendecker, Founder & CEO of SuiteC LLC. From the moment I met Bea, her unique blend of strategic vision, executive empathy and network-building prowess stood out. Bea has an uncanny ability to bring together C-suite leaders from diverse industries and create a community where knowledge, authenticity and high-integrity leadership flourish.

Throughout her work with SuiteC she has consistently demonstrated:

Visionary community-building – Bea built SuiteC around a powerful insight: senior executives are often isolated, and what they need most is a peer-driven forum of trust, candor and strategic growth. The structure she’s created provides exactly that. 

Executive insight paired with real-world application – She doesn’t just convene; she curates. The programs, think-tanks and roundtables she leads are business-first, outcome-oriented and time-efficient, respecting the demands on high-performing leaders. 
suitecllc.com

Integrity and authenticity – Bea models what she asks of others: a high EQ, a commitment to excellence, a willingness to challenge the status quo while lifting those around her. Her leadership inspires trust and encourages bold growth.

Impactful results – Participants in SuiteC walk away not just with ideas but with connections, accountability partners, strategic clarity and momentum. The value-creation is real.

If you’re looking for someone who not only envisions what’s next in executive leadership and peer networks but also delivers it, Bea is that person. I wholeheartedly endorse her and look forward to seeing the next chapter of what she builds.

Welcome to SuiteC
suitecllc.com

When I had specific questions about the employer, without hesitation, Bea provided sound timely responses.  Third, as an experienced finance professional with only the best education and financial acumen, Bea outshines others because she speaks finance and business perspicuously.  Bea ‘gets it’.


Having worked with recruiters as both a hiring manager and as a candidate, I know, without a doubt, that Bea is in a unique class as she drives for a truly successful match between employer and employee.  I look forward to working with her and Vaco on future requisitions.

headline: Turning Data Into Better Decisions | Follow Me for More Tech Insights | Technology Leader & Entrepreneur
about:
Working in technology for 18 years, I knew organizations and clients needed more help than industry was providing:

Here are some of the real challenges I saw clients and organizations facing:

🎯Feeling like people were throwing technology solutions at them without fully understanding the problem
🎯Knowing their data could be used for much more but not knowing how to do this
🎯Not having trusted and skilled advisors to be able to help them make technology decisions
🎯Feeling overwhelmed by the rate of technological change and not knowing where to begin
🎯Not having enough training or understanding to evaluate technology solutions
🎯Technology transformation failing because the people element was ignored
🎯Consultants not connecting the mission with the solution and technology

To solve these challenges, I knew I needed to start a dynamic technology company to bring together world-class talent to help our clients be more tech savvy and to help organizations adapt to new technologies.  

In 2022, Avenir Technology was born. Avenir means future. Because as Peter Drucker said, "the best way to predict the future is to create it." 

We are a team of 15 people who help our clients feel more comfortable with technology and help them adapt to new technologies faster and solve their organizational problems.

Our clients are in the public and commercial sectors. 

To learn more, visit: www.avenirtechnology.net. 

🚀 Ready to get started?  Book a 1-1 call with me: https://calendly.com/anicholson-dfa/30min.

👋 Want to be more tech savvy? Follow me!

publications.title: The Vast World Beyond Large Language Models
publications.summary: Dr. Yann LeCun, Meta’s Chief AI Scientist, argues that the current focus on scaling large language models (LLMs) is fundamentally misguided if our goal is human-level intelligence. In a recent NVIDIA GTC talk, he proposed that “world models”—self-supervised, multimodal systems built on Joint Embedding Predictive Architectures (JEPAs)—offer a more promising path toward artificial general intelligence (AGI). Unlike LLMs, which are limited to discrete text tokens and lack persistent memory, true reasoning, planning, or interaction with the physical world, world models learn by predicting and simulating real-world dynamics across text, images, audio, and video. Rooted in work by David Ha, Jürgen Schmidhuber, Fei-Fei Li, and others, these architectures mimic how humans build internal representations—observing, categorizing, and anticipating outcomes—without relying on massive, labeled datasets. LeCun envisions a hybrid future in which LLMs handle language tasks while world models drive robotics, autonomous vehicles, healthcare diagnostics, and national-security applications by “reading the room,” reasoning about consequences, and executing complex physical tasks—ultimately reshaping our approach to AI development and edging us closer to AGI.

experiences.jobDescription:
Our philosophy: 
We believe in using our marketing efforts for good: Marketing Made Human. Not only do we want our clients to be successful and our team to love coming into work every day, we want our company to stand for something positive in the world.

About the CEO: 
Jennelle McGrath started her first company at the age of 18 when she was still studying business and marketing at Merrimack College. By the time she graduated, she was running an established business with a full client list and several employees. Jennelle spent the next 15 years becoming a serial entrepreneur, but her love of helping people eventually led her back to her roots. Her true love was and always has been marketing.

Jennelle started Market Veep out of a passion for helping businesses reach a broader market, get more leads, and improve their sales and marketing alignment. Since then, she’s helped tech companies, start-ups, franchises, non-profits, service companies, distributors, manufacturers, law firms, and many other types of businesses acquire new customers. Jennelle believes that people are the most important part of any business. The human factor is what influences her marketing method, her business philosophy, and her focus on company culture.

publications.title: 5 Questions Businesses Ask When Optimizing Their Website
publications.summary:
Sometimes website optimization is only a matter of making some small changes, but the problem is often related to several parts of the website, like its design, concept, and content. Faced with this challenge, it’s difficult to know where to start.

 Here are five of the most common questions regarding website optimization and how to answer them:

1.  Can I keep all the content of my website and just make it look better?
2.  Why are mobile friendly websites  important to my inquiry volume?
3.  How can we use our website to target specific types of markets?
4.  What are the most important things to consider during website optimization?
5.   How do I operate my website's design?

publications.title: 5 Questions Lawyers Ask When Redesigning Their Website
publications.summary:
Maybe your lawyer website isn't getting any traffic, or maybe your viewers aren’t translating into leads. If your phone isn't ringing, it might be time to redesign your lawyer website!

Redesigning can seem like a difficult process, but it's worth it to make sure your website is working and converting leads. 

In this ebook, you discover:
-The overall purpose of your lawyer website
-Helpful things to consider during the redesigning process
-The importance of a mobile-friendly website
-How you can target specific practice areas with your website
-How to leverage your existing content
-How to get more traffic to your website

publications.title: 6 Marketing Metrics Your Boss Actually Cares About
publications.summary:
When it comes to marketing metrics that matter to your execs, expect to report on data that deals with the total cost of marketing, salaries, overhead, revenue, and customer acquisitions. This guide will walk you through the six critical marketing metrics your boss actually wants to know. In this guide, you will learn:

-Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC)
-Marketing % of Customer Acquisition Cost
-Ratio of Customer Lifetime Value to CAC (LTV:CAC)
-Time to Payback CAC
-Marketing Originated Customer %
-Marketing Influenced Customer %

publications.title: An Introduction to Growth Driven Design
publications.summary:
Your website is the centerpiece of all your marketing activities. It's also your "best salesperson." But if websites are so critical, why would we still build them using a broken design process?

In this eBook, you'll learn why growth-driven design is now the most affordable and results-driven method for building a website. We'll cover the following topics:
-The traditional website design process
-The risks of traditional website design
-How to think smarter about website design
-The three pillars of growth-driven design
-The phases of growth-driven design
-How growth-driven design drives results

publications.title: B2B Marketing on LinkedIn
publications.summary:
Businesses find success with B2B marketing on LinkedIn because it is one of the only social networking sites whose content is catered specifically to business professionals. In this eBook you will learn valuable information like:
-The benefits of keeping up with LinkedIn and all its opportunities
-How to use LinkedIn's search tools to your benefit
-How to post the right content to get your company noticed
-How to use LinkedIn Advertising to drive in leads

publications.title: Blogging That Gets Your Business Noticed
publications.summary:
Learn how to increase your website traffic and lead conversions with blogging.

These days, visitors to business websites expect to see more than a pretty picture and a product offer. They expect to see demonstrated industry expertise, practical advice, and accessible content. Business blogging has now become a standard marketing practice in a variety of industries. Whether you are a blogging veteran or your company is writing its very first post, our ebook can help you write and promote your blog as part of a successful marketing campaign. 

Inside, you'll learn:
-How blogging is taking the lead on content marketing 
-How to write engaging and useful copy that converts your readers
-How to target a specific market with your blog
-How to post on a schedule
-How to promote your blog online to increase visitors to your website
-How to leverage your blog for success

publications.title: Facebook Marketing: Get Your Business Noticed On Facebook
publications.summary:
LEARN TO PROMOTE YOUR BUSINESS THROUGH FACEBOOK!
This Facebook Marketing eBook will guide you in the right direction to get your business promoted quickly, covering topics such as business pages, AD's, and live streaming! In this eBook, you will find information on the following:

- Serious businesses with Facebook pages
- The power of Facebook Advertisements
- Facebook live streaming
- The future of Facebook marketing

publications.title: How to Monitor Social Media in 10 Minutes a Day
publications.summary:
This ebook is built to help you formulate a plan whereby in ten minutes a day, you can monitor the social media information you need within a tight, streamlined strategy.

-Your 10-minute checklist

publications.title: How to Set SMART Marketing Goals
publications.summary:
Determine Your SMART Marketing Goals!
Prepare for SMART Marketing with this Goal-Setting Excel Template.

As you plan for a new year, quarter, or month, it's time to determine your SMART marketing goals.

SMART is a methodology that helps you establish concrete and achievable goals. SMART stands for Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant, and Time-bound.

To help you align your marketing efforts with SMART goals, our Partner HubSpot built this marketing planning template that you can download for free. It will specifically help you:
-Easily summarize your ultimate marketing goals
-Automatically calculate your greatest marketing need
-Set a deadline for meeting your annual, quarterly, or monthly goals
-Start creating your new goals with this free template by filling out the form!

publications.title: Inbound Marketing: How It's Done and Why It Works in Language You Can Understand
publications.summary:
Inbound marketing took off in the digital age because it matched up well with people’s online habits. People crave useful information. 

Now, it’s a simple matter of placing useful information where your customers can find it.

This eBook describes the building blocks of inbound marketing and how the inbound marketing methodology can benefit your business. Inside, you’ll learn about:
-Buyer personas
-The Buyer’s Journey
-Attracting visitors
-Converting leads
-Closing sales
-Delighting customers
You’ll also learn how you can get started!

-Earn new clients & stay connected with them

-Use email marketing for consistent success 
-Learn how to share across social media
-Optimize your email marketing

publications.title: Should You Use a Marketing Agency or an In-house Marketing Department
publications.summary:
If you’ve decided that your business needs to increase its marketing efforts, you’ve got some choices. Depending on your industry and who you sell to, there are a number of marketing strategies that could be to your benefit. But before you worry about strategy, you have an important decision to make. Should you use a marketing agency or an in-house marketing department?

When you use a marketing agency, you get the benefits of copywriters, designers, web developers, and SEO experts for a fraction of the monthly costs of an in-house department. In this eBook, you’ll learn the following:
-The costs of hiring your own marketing staff
-How much time and money you can save by using a marketing agency
-Why successful marketing takes a team of professionals
-The broad range of skills an agency can offer your business
-How to hold your agency partner accountable
-Why businesses rely on agencies for their marketing efforts

publications.title: The 30 Greatest Lead Generation Tips, Tricks and Ideas
publications.summary:
This eBook explains in detail, the 30 greatest lead generation tips, tricks & ideas!
So what goes into a best-of-class lead generation engine? This eBook takes a deeper look into the mechanics of high performing lead generation campaigns covering topics such as:
-Tips, Trick & Ideas
-Content & Offers
-Calls-to-Action
-Landing Pages
-Forms
-Channels

publications.title: The Advanced Guide to Sales and Marketing Alignment
publications.summary:
What does it mean to align sales and marketing?

Sales and marketing alignment is all about the customer. Look at your sales process from the customer’s perspective and determine what positive changes are necessary to make it smoother and more efficient. Internal changes may be necessary, but with a concerted effort you’ll improve both your customer retention rate and your sales-win rate by achieving total buyer engagement.

In this eBook, we’ll go over some of the best practices for aligning your sales and marketing teams, including:
-Measuring success together
-Sharing documents, calendars, and tools
-Holding regular meetings
-Working together to produce buyer personas
-Avoiding human error with automation
And if you outsource your marketing, we also have tips on how to align your marketing partner with your in-house sales team.

publications.title: The Benefits and Best Practices of Email Automation
publications.summary:
If you’ve ever set up an away message for your personal email account, you’ve already automated an email.
Email marketing automation is now essential for digital marketing. It saves you valuable time and helps you stay top-of-mind with your contacts.

In this eBook, you’ll learn:
-What a “workflow” is
-How to build a lead process
-How to send messages that get opened
-How to integrate sales automation
-How to get started
Ultimately, email marketing automation is a tool for building relationships. Start building!

publications.title: The Big 5: How to Use Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Snapchat and Twitter to Market Your Business
publications.summary:
Use Social Media Marketing to Drive In Leads
Social media marketing plays an extensive role in the digital marketing strategies of businesses all across the globe. A 2014 report from Social Media Examiner found that 92% of marketers had increased their exposure through social media platforms and 80% saw positive results in terms of website traffic because of it.

Ready to get social? In this eBook, you'll learn tips and tricks for...
Facebook Marketing
Instagram Marketing
LinkedIn Marketing
Snapchat Marketing
Twitter Marketing

publications.title: The Fundamentals of Online Lead Generation for Lawyers
publications.summary:
Lead generation for lawyers has become an essential part of every practice, but lawyers are often too stressed for time to implement a complicated lead generation system. Thankfully, there are some fundamental practices that generate actionable leads lawyers.

In this eBook, you’ll learn how to create a lead generation system that will convert clients online and get your phone to ring. We’ll cover the following topics:
-Redesigning your website
-Content marketing
-Pay-per-click ads
-Social media marketing
-Search Engine Optimization
-Measuring metrics

publications.title: The Legal Marketing Action Guide
publications.summary:
Legal marketing has become more competitive. Lawyers need every advantage to attract new clients. In the latter part of the 20th century, people in need of legal assistance found lawyers through traditional advertisements and through referrals from friends and coworkers. Today, everyone is searching online.

You may already have a website, but if you aren’t deploying a full array of marketing tactics, your phone won’t be ringing. In this eBook, you will learn the benefits of the following:
-Online content
-Search engine optimization (SEO)
-Website functionality
-Email and live chat
-Social media management
-Metrics and measurement

publications.title: The Multichannel SaaS Marketing Guide
publications.summary:
Multichannel marketing can help you outrank your competitors in search engines results, provide more assistance to potential customers, and establish yourself as an authority in your niche market. Most importantly, each channel contributes toward a singular goal: to get more subscribers to your SaaS.

In this eBook, you'll learn how the following marketing channels work for SaaS companies:
-Website Optimization
-Email Marketing
-Content Marketing
-Social Media Marketing
-Paid Advertisements
-Webinars
-LinkedIn Social Selling

publications.title: The No-Nonsense Guide to Online Lead Generation
publications.summary:
The goal of online lead generation is to capture a prospect’s attention the moment they start searching. Once they find your business, whether it is through an ad, a piece of useful content, or another strategy, they will start on the buyer’s journey and enter the sales funnel.

Lead generation isn’t just about getting qualified lead into the sales funnel. It’s also about pushing them further down toward a buying decision. You can do this by nurturing them and building trust along the way.

In this eBook, you’ll learn how to build an online lead generation system by doing the following:
-Identifying your leads
-Top of funnel lead generation
-Middle of funnel lead nurturing
-Bottom of the funnel selling

headline: Peak Performance Sales Advisor | Helping Sales Reps & Teams Hit Big Numbers Differently | 67% Faster Close Time | Overcoming Buyer’s Status Quo | $250M Sold | 3x #1 WW | 400% Close Rate Increase | The Multiplier Method™
jobTitle: CEO & Founder | Sales Performance, Training & Enablement
about:
I help sales professionals hit BIG numbers and connect with their clients to move them from status quo/do nothing, to closed with impact.  

And do so... with more personal ease, joy, and connection. 

This is where Top 1% Sales Results Meet Science. 

Sales and the buyer's journey are changing and innovation in the sales arena is needed to both connect with buyers, but also increase the wellbeing of anyone selling. 

The great news is that the approach is game-changing, easily applied, and can be done in the moment of the deal. 

I would describe myself as a research geek—obsessed with the science behind what actually works at scale and applying tools in the moment of the deal vs theory. I spend my time creating insights that combine both in-the-trenches experience with science. I research how people actually buy. What reduces buying friction and seller bias. How our brains work under pressure. What makes hard things easier instead of just harder.

I've been in the sales trenches for 32 years, 3x #1 WW, sold the largest deals in company history 3x, broke barriers and set records at each position and company along my career, scaling best practices, innovating approaches, and selling over $250M. 

I was known for increasing deal size and decreasing time to close and doing it by working smarter, not harder. 

I've also spent time in sales enablement building growth programs. Testing them. Scaling them. The result? 

Reps in my programs closed at 43% vs rest of the company at 8%. Same product. Same market. Different human approach.

Now I've created the Creator of The Multiplier Method™ & the Million Dollar W2™ Sales system. 

It's about helping sales pros and teams Work Smarter, Not Harder. 
A three-pronged approach based in behavioral science, behavioral economics, neuroscience, peak performance, positive psychology, and more. 

It's where streetwise meets science and engineers sales systems and approaches that work to create greater sales numbers while also creating greater health, wealth, and relationship success for both the sales pro and their company. 

I care deeply about purpose, impact, elevating the sales profession, and making a difference - at work, home, and in the world. 

I've partnered with B1G1 so that when something good happens at work, something great happens in the world. To me, this partnership is about making the world better while building sales lives and careers. 

If working smarter and not harder resonates, join me in my newsletter: https://multipliers.mattersofgrowth.com/newsletter

Or reach out for a DM and let's talk.

experiences.title: CEO & Founder | Sales Performance, Training & Enablement
experiences.jobDescription:
There’s a new way to win.

Matters of Growth helps sales professionals and teams hit big numbers, move clients past do nothing/status quo to closed, and do it with more ease, joy, and connection.

The proof:
→ Reps in our programs: 43% close rate vs 8% company average
→ 4x close rates
→ 10x deal size
→ Sales cycles shortened by 2/3rds 

The approach:
Most sales advice says work harder. More calls. More pressure. More hours.

We take a different approach. 

It’s where sales success meets streetwise and science. 

30 elite years in the trenches combined with behavioral science, behavioral economics, cognitive science, peak performance research, positive psychology, neuroscience, and sales psychology. We translate best-in- class proven performance practices into the sales arena.

We align the human aspect of selling with how buyers actually buy. Reducing friction for both the buyer and the seller.

Not theory.

Practical tools that work in the moment of the deal. That build skill, competency, capacity, & capability.

What we develop:

Future-Proof Capabilities (Gartner & Forrester-backed):
→ AQ (Adversity Quotient) and Antifragility
→ EQ (Emotional Intelligence)
→ Tactical flexibility
→ Mentalizing
→ Conviction and confidence under pressure
→ Trust-building execution

Mental Models:
→ Growth mindset
→ 80/20 thinking
→ 10x thinking
→ Pro vs Amateur

Performance Science:
→ Energy management and strategic recovery
→ Identity and self-concept that drives execution
→ Routines, rituals, and habits that compound

These aren’t soft skills. 
They’re performance multipliers.
Not just hitting numbers, but building a career that lasts.

We offer programs for individual reps and training/enablement for companies building elite teams.

Matters of Growth is a mission-driven social enterprise. Through B1G1, we link client impact to global giving.

Because when people grow, so does everything else.

updates.postText:
You can't outwork your way to a 10x deal.

It takes: 
→ Seeing differently 
→ Believing differently 
→ Making different moves

15 colleagues told me to walk away.

"Don't touch it."
"Client just renewed."
"Look the other way."

I didn't look the other way.
I addressed it. 

It turned into the largest deal in company history.

That wasn't the first time.

I've closed bellwether deals at every position along my career. The deals no one thought were possible. 

10x. 20x. 

Deals that changed what people believed was doable.

Here's what I know after 32 years:

Most reps unconsciously think smaller than they need to.

Some of it's fear. 
Your brain quietly shrinks what feels safe.

Some of it's bias. 
You've never seen it done, so it doesn't feel possible.

🏃 It's the 4-minute mile all over again.

In 1954, Roger Bannister became the first person to run a mile in under 4 minutes.

Before that? 
Experts said it was physically impossible. The human body couldn't do it.

Then Bannister did it.

And here's the wild part:
Within one year, dozens of runners broke the same barrier.

Nothing changed physically. 
No new training methods. 
No new shoes.

What changed was belief.

Once one person proved it was possible, everyone else's mental ceiling lifted.

💡 Same thing happens in sales.

When you've never seen a 10x deal, it doesn't feel possible.

When you're surrounded by people who close big, it becomes the norm.✨

You're already working hard.
If you can't work harder, what are your options?

More deals. 
Or bigger deals.

And let's be real.
Deal size isn't just about quota. 

It's mortgage payments. 🏡
College funds. 🏫
Family vacations. 🏖️

It's being present instead of grinding nights and weekends.

This free LinkedIn Live session is about resetting how you think about big deals as you plan your territory.

Bigger deals from the same effort. 
Not more hours. More impact. ✨ 

Plus AI prompts to help you think differently. ✨ 

See the event listed below to get this on your calendar.

Let's go bigger together. 

♻️ Send this to a teammate. Repost for your network. 

🔥 Follow Holly Moe for insights that create outsized success in sales and life.
A seven-week live bootcamp for ambitious sellers who want 2026 to be a career-defining year. Sharpen your edge, tighten your systems, and scale your deals.

His commitment to his team’s success was remarkable—he went the extra mile to ensure they had the tools, support, and guidance needed to thrive.

David cared deeply about the whole person, not just performance metrics. He actively sought innovative approaches to equip his team with master-level sales strategies and mindset tools, enabling them to succeed not just in the short term but in a sustainable way. His leadership style combined this deep care with an ability to make even the serious aspects of work fun and engaging. He kept the team moving forward while also creating a positive, motivating environment.

David is also a joy to collaborate with. His balance of support, innovation, and genuine care makes him an exceptional leader. If you're looking for someone who is passionate about success and knows how to build it, I highly recommend connecting with David.

publications.title: The effects of bupropion on autonomic response to mental stress
publications.summary:
PURPOSE: The chemical structure of bupropion is related to amphetamine,
thus, it may have cardiovascular stimulatory properties. This study examined
the effects of acute administration of bupropion on autonomic response in
humans before, during, and after voluntary subjection to mental stress.
METHODS: Healthy, adult volunteers were eligible for this double-blind,
crossover, placebo-controlled, single-center pilot study. Subjects were
randomized to receive sustained-release bupropion titrated to 150 mg twice
daily over 7 days, or corresponding placebo, with a three day wash-out period
between treatments. After each treatment period, each subject underwent a 2-
hour clinic visit, where separate speech and math “stress” tests were
administered. Heart rate was recorded every minute, and plasma
catecholamines were measured before, during and after each stress test.
RESULTS: Twelve subjects participated in this study. Average heart rates were
significantly higher after bupropion versus placebo 30 minutes prior to
speech test administration (74 vs 65, p<0.0003), while subjects listened to
their recorded speech, (83 vs 73, p<0.008), and 15 minutes after speech and
math tests (81 vs 75, p<0.007). Plasma norepinephrine serum levels were
significantly higher in subjects after taking bupropion versus placebo during
speech test administration, (260 ± 100 vs 207 ± 124 pg/ml, p<0.03).
CONCLUSIONS: Autonomic response to mental stress was greater after
treatment with bupropion for 7 days than placebo. These alterations in heart
rate and plasma norepinephrine levels may be detrimental in patients at
increased risk for cardiovascular disease. Further studies are necessary to
establish definitive effects of bupropion on hemodynamic variables and the
potential clinical consequences.

updates.postText:
𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗔𝗰𝘁 𝗟𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗮 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿

In our Leadership Academy session on Becoming a Strategic Leader, we cover the essentials—the three layers of strategy—corporate, business, and functional—and how they are conceptualized through strategic foresight, strategic thinking, and strategic planning.

Leaders need an effective strategic planning roadmap designed to achieve positive results.

1️⃣ STRATEGIC FORESIGHT - THE WHY: 
This is about the overarching strategy. It is about anticipating the future. 

By defining the "why," you define your organization's overarching purpose and long-term direction.

Ask:
🔸 What are the trends, challenges, and opportunities? 
🔸 What trends could impact our industry or organization?
🔸 Why should we pursue markets, products, or services over others?
🔸 Is our current mission/vision relevant, and how does it need to evolve?
🔸 What risks or opportunities could arise, and how should we prepare for them?

2️⃣ STRATEGIC THINKING - THE HOW: 
How will you and the organization compete effectively in your markets? 

Strategic thinking involves analyzing the competitive environment, understanding customer needs, and crafting unique value propositions.

Strategic thinking is about gaining a competitive edge by translating foresight into actionable strategies that define how the business will achieve its objectives.

Ask:
🔸 How can we differentiate ourselves from competitors?
🔸 How will our strategies address changes in customer needs?
🔸 How do we leverage our strengths to capitalize on opportunities and respond to competitive threats?
🔸 How can we foster innovation to stay ahead in the marketplace?
🔸 What are we not seeing?

3️⃣ STRATEGIC PLANNING - THE WHAT:

As a leader, you must think through your operations (marketing, HR, sales, finance, etc.) to ensure alignment with business objectives.

The "what" consists of specific activities, resources, and timelines to execute the business strategy.

Ask:
🔸 What specific actions are needed to achieve our strategic objectives?
🔸 What resources are required to execute successfully?
🔸 What are the timelines and milestones needed to execute?
🔸 What metrics will we use to measure progress/success?
🔸 What contingencies are needed in case things don't go as planned?

Where does strategy fail the most? Patrick McKenna addresses this question in his posts. His work is brilliant. ou should follow him. Here's his latest strategy post:   https://lnkd.in/eup4qeER

Your partner in success, Joe Murphy

𝐒𝐄𝐌𝐈𝐍𝐀𝐑: 𝐀𝐫𝐞 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐖𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐘𝐎𝐔 𝐆𝐞𝐭 𝐌𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐃𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐓𝐡𝐚𝐧 𝐎𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐒?

For 30 years, I've studied success and achievement, looking for the Holy Grail. What I discovered is it's NOT only one thing that makes a person successful; it is a combination of things that they apply that does.

Let's confirm what you already know.

We all get 24 hours in a day. But you, like most high achievers, get more done in 2 hours than most people get done in a day, and maybe even a week.

And, like most high-achievers, you don't suffer burnout. You may try to get too much done and get frazzled, but that's when you step back and use one of the 9 tools below. 

The infographic should be titled BUILDING MOMENTUM FOR A GREAT LIFE. The tools in the infographic help you reprioritize your life to align with what you want and make work fun.

The tools can be used to coach yourself. Here's how I use them when coaching others: 

1. DECIDE TO BECOME EXCELLENT. Once you are excellent, you never have to worry about losing your job or money again. This is a game-changer. 

2. THE MINDSET SHIFT. Cultivate a growth mindset. See life and work as a big game, a learning experience.

3. THE BIG GAME APPROACH. This doesn't mean you don't take your work seriously; just don't take yourself too seriously. 

4. REFRAME EVENTS. See your work, associated tasks, victories, and setbacks as fun and learning experiences. Yes. You are becoming a high achiever, and as a high achiever, you will suffer setbacks - but you know that since you are already a high achiever.

5. CHALLENGE YOURSELF. See how much you can do better than yesterday. Set little goals and targets: "Let's see if I can beat yesterday's number."

6. DON'T COMPARE. Remember, comparison to others is a trap. 

7. ABSORB MATERIAL AND APPLY. You get more ideas by applying new material quickly, testing the ideas, and adapting them to your style.

8. CREATE INCREMENTAL DIFFERENCES. You don't have to have gigantic improvements. Look for the more minor, incremental differences.

9. BUILD MOMENTUM. Use incremental differences (#8 above) to build momentum. Momentum is like compound interest. It becomes a powerful "Snowball effect."

10. USE TOOLS AND STRATEGIES. Learn to use each tool in the infographic below to gain and keep that positive momentum to move you forward. I know I do, and they have changed my life and the lives of countless others.
____________________
This is one of the training sessions I put on for executives and high potential managers over Zoom and in person. It is one of the most popular sessions due to the competing priorities managers and frontline workers are faced with daily.

If you are interested in how I do these sessions contact me: joe@josephbmurphy.com
___________________

𝐀𝐫𝐞 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐟𝐟 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐒𝐤𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐬?

Warren Bennis wrote, "We can never have too many leaders." And I agree.

If you are not teaching your staff leadership skills, you may be missing the biggest opportunity of your career.

If you are a manager, #CEO, #CHRO, or division president, you want an ongoing leadership training program for everyone. It doesn't have to be 3 or 4 days of classes.

90-𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐖𝐞𝐞𝐤𝐥𝐲 𝐙𝐨𝐨𝐦 𝐌𝐞𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬
I work with several organizations where I facilitate leadership sessions several times a week. These sessions bring people together to learn lessons from industry experts and the organization's most experienced people so people who are on the frontline can discuss what they did to be successful.

The sessions are lively, authentic, and informative. People come away with at least 2 or 3 things to implement immediately and they do!

Bringing people with 30 days of experience with people with 30 years of experience produces a powerful bond. People see each other differently. It builds camaraderie and reinforces a collaborative culture.

𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐬:
1) PROFITS AND RETENTION
These organizations produce more profits, revenue, and results, and retention rates are unreal compared to the industry.

2) TRUST AND PRIORITIES
People prioritize their work to get results, and this alignment creates a bond of trust between managers and staff.

3) PRODUCTIVITY, GROWTH, AND EXCITEMENT
Imagine working in an office where there is no conflict, everyone is rowing in the same direction, and people are enthusiastic about learning and developing their talents to the full. Is this possible?

4) LIFE SKILLS
Surveys report that these sessions not only help people do their work better in the office but also, more amazingly, that people report their home life is better. People are taking the lessons home to teach their spouses and children!!

Talk about a competitive advantage in the hiring marketplace.

The skills in the infographic are an excellent start for teaching and coaching others. Here are several other topics to consider that I use:

▪️ Leadership for Results
▪️ How to Become an Effective Manager
▪️ How To Be a Great Team Member
▪️ How to Run Meetings for Results
▪️ Creating Trust
▪️ Why EQ trumps IQ
▪️ Time Management (get 2x done with no stress)
▪️ Negotiation Skills
▪️ How to Inspire To 2x People
▪️ Feedback - how to give it and how to ask for it
▪️ The Creative Manager
▪️ How to Get the Right Things Done
▪️ Become a Trust Advisor to Your Clients
▪️ Consultative Selling - Moving Customers to Clients

And many more

Best of success this week, Joe Murphy

Dear Friends.

I want to thank every one of you for making this book possible. To my LinkedIn contacts and associates, former colleagues, and clients—I owe you an enormous debt of gratitude for making this book possible.

Many people inspired me to write this book. Since leaving the corporate world after 30 years, I stepped out onto the edge of the abyss and leaped into the darkness, pushing aside the fear of not making it, and here I am, still standing. My old friend fear is still there; it is swimming beneath the surface, doing push-ups in the parking lot, ready for me to blink. You all continue to support me in many ways that you will never know—thank you.

To all who said yes and commented on this book—you will see your name on the pages. You look great in print!

Thank you to the clients who have contracted my services.

To my clients who subscribe to The Leadership Academy and ask me to deliver—the pleasure and satisfaction are all mine—I learn more from your people than they learn from me.

I am "officially" (whatever that means) releasing my book, 𝑪𝒍𝒊𝒎𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝑳𝒆𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒓𝒔𝒉𝒊𝒑 𝑺𝒖𝒎𝒎𝒊𝒕 - 𝑪𝒓𝒆𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝑳𝒆𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒓𝒔 𝑨𝒕 𝑨𝒍𝒍 𝑳𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒍𝒔, today.

It is available on Amazon. I discounted the softcover version to $7 and the Kindle version to $1.99 (I couldn't get it to 99 cents because there are too many diagrams). 
_____________________
The book link to Amazon is here: https://lnkd.in/e8RYJyH4

I reduced the price on both versions as much as Amazon would allow me in hopes that—I won't lie about it—you'd buy the book and give it five (5) stars and a good review.
______________________

All proceeds (every cent) will go to 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗪𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗪𝗮𝗿𝗿𝗶𝗼𝗿 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁. The money won't make a dent in what they need, but it is a worthy cause, and making a dent is a worthy goal.

Once again, thank you to everyone on the LinkedIn platform and all of you who comment and "like" my posts—I appreciate you.

Sincerely, your partner in success, Joe Murphy

PS - I am genuinely here for your success.

Here are samples from the book and the nice words you have said about me and the book. Thank you again.

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗮 𝗗𝗶𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝘂𝗹𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
 
The first question is: When do you have a difficult conversation? 

𝗧𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗿𝘂𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗜 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽 𝘆𝗼𝘂.

1. If something happens once between you and someone else, notice it. 
- You don't make it a big deal, but you do make a note of it.
- You may say to myself, “Well, I had an emotional response to that, or something didn’t seem right.”

2. If it happens again, you wonder if there is a pattern.
- You notice it once again, but your antennae is up.

3. The third time it happens, you make sure you have a conversation with the person
- You know if you don't have the conversation it's going to come out in some way that you won't be your best self
- If you wait past the third time, it will be more difficult than it needs to be.

The next step 

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝘂𝗹𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 - 𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗗𝗼 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗗𝗼 𝗜𝘁?

1. The most important thing you can do is to get into a listening mode. 
2. Obviously, when you decide to have the difficult conversation you have something to say. You have to resist the urge to say something.
3. What you do here is take a deep breath, and ask the person a question. Ask, "Can you tell me what your intention was when you said XYZ?"
4. The best thing you could do in a hard-to-have conversation is let the other person speak.
_____________________
When you allow the person to speak . . . Here's What Happens:
- When they speak, their defensiveness goes down and so does yours.
- You both are starting to relax because you are open and listening. 
- You are actually hearing what the person has to say.
- You’re also picking up some pretty useful information about what they meant and/or how they felt.
_____________________

5. You repeat back what you heard and ask "Did I get what you said?"
6. After they say, "Yes, that's it," you say: "Let me give you a sense as to what’s going on for me.”

So you always want to start with a question. 

Then it’s going to be a conversation and not two people yelling at each other. They’re going to be able to hear what you have to say and the results will more than likely be productive. 

Your partner in success, Joe Murphy

publications.title: Climbing the Leadership Summit: Creating Leaders At All Levels
publications.summary:
𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗨𝗡𝗜𝗤𝗨𝗘 𝗩𝗔𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗕𝗢𝗢𝗞
In The Leadership Academy programs we run for clients, we discuss the psychological aspects of leadership and success. People go from looking at work as only an 8 to 5 job to using work as a vocation and a way to develop themselves into their best possible selves.

𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗔𝘁 𝗔𝗹𝗹 𝗟𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹𝘀
People return to their jobs with a different outlook, an outlook of realizing they can turn their workplace into fun and excitement, feeling empowered, and feeling like they are part of something big, something bigger than themselves. They return to their work with a sense of purpose.

One of the chief concepts I promote in 𝘾𝙡𝙞𝙢𝙗𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙇𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙝𝙞𝙥 𝙎𝙪𝙢𝙢𝙞𝙩, 𝘾𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙇𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙨 𝙖𝙩 𝘼𝙡𝙡 𝙇𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙡𝙨, stems from The Leadership Academy seminars, that leadership is a way of acting that inspires others to perform at higher levels and become their best selves on the way toward the objective and that leadership can be learned and should be learned by everyone at all levels of the organization.

The result is the beginning of creating leaders at all levels.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗜𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗿
Organizations must create leaders at all levels to win employees over and help them get back on track and thrive. This is the primary duty of the direct manager, with the help and support of Human Resources.

In this book, I leverage 21 Best Practices to demonstrate how managers can empower their people, create a collaborative workplace, have fun, and help people feel valued as they achieve their goals.

These 21 Best Practices are foundational for managers at all levels and individuals wanting to climb the leadership summit.

publications.title: Book: Living by Design - Rethinking How We Think
publications.summary:
Book LIVING BY DESIGN - RETHINKING HOW WE THINK. 
266 pages - Originally written for the author for the author - strategies to keep him aligned with what he wants - how to be in the world and not of the world.

A collection of strategies and approaches to help you rethink how you think and design a life of your choosing -- LIVING BY DESIGN.
________________________________
CONTRARY TO POPULAR BELIEF, the greatest achievements are not the result of being born into success. Nor does success and living a good life come from luck. Success in any discipline comes from a steady, calm approach to living a life by design once the person has decided to create a vision of what he wants and pursues it. The decision to pursue this vision of the future and using the vision to design to one’s life in order to achieve it is the beginning of change, and ultimately, transformation.

--> Top performers know what they want, and they have developed a greater ability to focus on the steps and actions needed to pursue their vision.
      
--> Top performers use a vision of what they want to create an overarching strategy that guides their actions and behaviors.
          
LIVING BY DESIGN IS A PRACTICAL GUIDE to developing effective strategies that, if applied consistently, will transform how you live and help you attain your goals and aspirations. By developing new thinking skills, you will learn to develop a new self-concept of who you think you are and allow you to become everything you were designed to be. 

DO THESE CONCEPTS WORK? Yes. I have been using these concepts to help people achieve self-mastery, become more authentic, realize their goals, and in a spiritual sense, live their lives as intended, by design. 
  
MY AIM IS to teach you the key principles used by people who have achieved mastery so you can tap into your hidden talents and discover the inner genius within you by helping your RETHINK HOW YOU THINK and CREATE a NEW LIFE -- A LIFE BY DESIGN -- YOUR DESIGN

publications.title: Meditations for the Modern Man (and Woman)
publications.summary:
Zen Meditations for the Modern Man is a series of practices designed to help you master your thinking and overcome your fears, worries, and anxiety by creating a new structure of thoughts and actions aligned with a vision of the future based on what you want. It is a guide for living a life in accord to your design without the constraints imposed by others.

At the end of each chapter or practice, the author has summarized the key points with a series of affirmations (I ams) designed to drive these positive messages into your core so that you can live friction-free in a world that is continuously trying to knock you off balance.

James Holt, General Manager, Microsoft said,  "Riveting insight and a must read for any leader  looking toward the future."
--------------------------------------------


Clients reveal 7 strategies that exceptional professionals use to position their firms as the go-to solution provider. This study reveals--from the perspective of client decision-makers--what exceptional professionals  do that separate themselves from other professionals. Clients explain how you can model these same behaviors to resonate and differentiate you from your competitors.

recommendationsReceived.name: FLORE Dorcely-Mohr
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Your Recruiting Auntie/DE&I/Remote Work Champion
recommendationsReceived.context: FLORE worked with Joe but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description:
I have had the privilege of working closely with Joe Murphy during our time at Maximus, where he served as the Vice President of Employer Services. I can confidently say that Joe is a dedicated and empathic leader who has made an impact on me and countless others in our organization.  You would never know it by his humble demeanor, but he's written several books about the art and science of leadership.  

Under his expert guidance, Joe led a Leadership Academy course series attended by literally hundreds of employees, twice weekly, not just for those in his unit, but corporate-wide.  What sets Joe apart is not only his deep industry knowledge but also his commitment to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment. 

He is an outstanding communicator--always willing to lend an attentive ear and offer guidance.   He has been a personal inspiration to me, encouraging me to strive to do and be better for my team and my own professional development.  If you follow his LinkedIn page, you'll witness for yourself, how his dedication to mentoring and developing leadership talent has had a profound impact on people like me in so many ways.

In this capacity, Joe had a broad span of responsibilities: recruiting sales personnel, coaching and developing, setting the tone and the culture in one of our largest facilities and most importantly delivering results.  Joe is a consummate sales professional, has excellent executive presence, an ongoing thirst for knowledge and self improvement and delivers on his commitments.

recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Producing, polishing, and presenting content and documentation for organizations looking to find and/or save money

recommendationsReceived.description:
As Managing Director at Keane while I served, Joe was the consummate leader.  He was always close enough to help in times of need, but never so close that I felt cramped.

That was empowering.  I was in control of my success, and my clients' success, without feeling "out there alone".

He was a true "win-one-for-the Gipper" coach, too!  I remember one of his words-to-live-by talks he gave when we were at an organization-wide gathering (I paraphrase): "We know you are working hard; we see it in the results and the comments we get from your managers and clients.  Keep it up, and strive to be better...to go even further for your clients and your careers.  Remember, if you think you have everything under control, you should be working harder - moving even faster."

Joe is a rising star.  Catch him if you can!

He challenged us as a client individually and as a team to push ourselves beyond the conventional way of thinking to develop a clear execution plan with milestones that keeps us accountable. 

As we work with our new clients, we can see a marked difference in our culture and strategic perspective specifically aimed at making a difference for our clients in terms of results. 

Chris’s out of the box thinking and consultative nature directed our focus on bold initiatives that move the needle and drive performance.

We can’t say enough about Chris Justice and Coaching International.

recommendations.name: FLORE Dorcely-Mohr
recommendations.subtitle: Your Recruiting Auntie/DE&I/Remote Work Champion
recommendations.context: Joe was senior to FLORE but didn't manage FLORE directly
recommendations.description:
If you want to meet an extraordinary person, you should meet FLORE Dorcely-Mohr. I didn't know FLORE before I heard her speak on a Zoom call and it was clear, she not only knows what she is doing, she can make clear points that everyone understands and can rally behind. 

On that day, I knew I had to meet her one-on-one and from there, I invited her to speak on the Leadership Academy call in front of 200 executives and high potential leaders from across the world. She held their attention for 90 minutes - she was powerful.

FLORE is high energy, smart, witty, self-deprecating (in a nice way), and humble. These are rare qualities in any field but more important is the fact the FLORE cares and delivers on her commitments. She goes above and beyond what she promised and makes sure she exceeded your expectations. This is integrity in action or better: walking the talk.

I am so grateful to have met FLORE, I am her senior (OLDER - but I am older than everyone). She has taught me a lot in my short time knowing her. She reminded me what professionalism was and should be just by being in her presence. As soon as I think of FLORE, I sit up straight and I get my act together. That's the kind of effect she will have on you and your team.

PS - if you are being recruited by FLORE, know this: SHE WILL NEVER MAKE A COMMITMENT SHE CANNOT KEEP.  And listen to her - she will never steer you wrong. You are in good hands with FLORE.
